reviews.content: Are you kidding me to make this movie. Writer and director should go to jail.

Even though I was concerned this was skipping theaters, I really didn't expect this film to be this bad. The first one was a fun and enjoyable throwback to the 80s, but this sequel is just terrible. The plot is incoherent, the actions scenes are underwhelming, and worst of all is that the stars of the film, Stallone and Bautista, are barely even in it. Bautista in particular is completely wasted in this film. I have no idea why Sly and Bautista signed on for this.

reviews.review_title: I'm a Stallone fan, but this is bad...
reviews.content:
Ever since I was a kid and I saw Rambo II in the cinema, together with my dad, I've had a soft spot for Stallone (and his) movies. Some were better than others, but it was never really bad. This one, sadly, is. In the first minutes the bad acting stands out and you're nauseated by the shaky cam.
I'm really dissapointed, because I was looking forward to another Escape Plan movie, like the first one. And I just can't get my head around why the hell directors keep using shaky cam. It adds nothing to a scene other than rendering it unbearable to watch.

You know how you always get those cheap, nasty knock-off DVD's in the "discount" bin at video rental stores? The ones that have a cover similar to the original movie upon which they are (usually very loosely) based? The ones often put out by the likes of Asylum? Yeah, well, that is what Escape Plan 2 is. Or rather, it isn't, seeing as how it is an actual sequel to a much better film, complete with some of the original stars. But that is exactly how it feels - like someone said "Hey! Let's do a knock off of Escape Plan! It'll be great!"Except that EP2 is not great. It is, in fact, all kinds of not great. So many kinds of not great, in fact, that they could open a "Not great" store and sell the nonsense to other, less incompetent film-makers hoping to make a bad name for themselves in the rip-off business.Little about the movie really works. Even the presence of actors such as Stallone and Bautista can't do more than highlight how bad everything around them is. And it is bad, trust me.The sets for the titular prison "Hades" are garishly lit with neon lighting, like a bad Tron ripoff. And that prison is not any prison that could ever be made on Earth. It is something from the future. They have, in addition to the neon lighting, force-fields, robots, hi-tech electro shock things and...my personal favourite... magic manacles that spring out of literally nowhere to shackle two prisoners together. No, I really mean that...out of nowhere!This is the kind of movie I watched in the 80's with mates and a big old crate of beer. We'd sit, we'd drink and we'd mock the crap out of the awful movies we were watching. Well...I'm old now, my mates are far away and that crate of beer steadfastly refused to be a part of this watching, so I guess it sucks to be me. In fact, it sucks to be anyone that has to endure this movie. There is nothing here that you won't have seen in the original (except for the garish lighting and...oh! Did I mention the discordant, overly strident music? I didn't? Well now I have!) For extra bonus "bad" points, the music sometimes drowns out the character dialogue (which, in hindsigfht, is probably a mercy). Absolutely nothing here is worth your time. This isn't sequel bad. It's sequel to a sequel to a sequel bad.Still not convinced? Take a gander at the crew credits. Now, I know it is fashionable to give a producer credit to all and sundry when making a movie, but thirty-three of them? Let that settle in for a moment. Thirty-three producers, executive producers and co-producers. In fact, very nearly as many producers as there are actors in this film (and yes, I am counting the random prisoners too). That's too many, people! Have you never heard of the saying about too many cooks, and broth?Still, still not convinced? "Well," You say. "I like prison breakout movies. I'll find something to like!" No...you won't. Because even if there was something to like...say... the fight scenes... they are utterly ruined by the over-reliance on "Shaky-Cam (tm)"! Yes, swoon as you have little idea of what is going on in a fight scene. Frown as you wonder why even non-fight scenes merit the scene-disrupting presence of the worst gimmick to be consistently overdone since the invention of 3D. Seriously, the shaky-cam...the ever-present neon lighting and some questionable cutting and editing, all make this an assault far worse than anything endured by the movie's characters.Then there are the FX. Super-imposed explosions that look straight out of Southpark. A garage door bursting open as a car rams through it...before the car actually reaches it... you get the idea.I don't know what else to say. It is bad. Badly made. Poorly scripted. Weakly acted and with a story/sets and premise that is just laughable.SUMMARY: Awful, charmless assault on the senses. Bad story, sets and camerawork. Loud obnoxious music. Garish lighting. Like watching a bad film in a disco. A really bad disco. Do yourselves a favour...don't bother with this one.

reviews.review_title: Sly, what the hell were you thinking??
reviews.content:
I suppose Sly did an 'Arnold', as in "Killing Gunther".
Lending your face to a turd that you know is a turd, so you can earn a few bucks?I don't understand this at all, both of these guys have earned and still earn several hundred millions of dollarsAnd they still want to be a part of such student-projects.Flabbergasting.
Why?Ignore whatever reasons you may have to watch this movie (Stallone, Batista, etc).Its incredibly awful :(

reviews.review_title: Poorly filmed fight choreography... worst I have seen in years.
reviews.content: There may have been some good fights in this movie but you can't see them becuase somebody decided to only film the actors faces and shake the camera as much as possible during all major fight scene. poor lighting and over saturated tones did not help this situation.

Okay this movie show Stallone and Bautista as big people who probably be main character in this movie their names are even on the cover but they barely play a part in the whole movie. The plot is everywhere, characters are uninteresting and I could not find myself getting attached to any of them, I'd say just skip this movie. I only give it a two because it doesn't deserve to be first in anything not even in bad movies.

reviews.review_title: A lot of actions without a point
reviews.content: Well let be honest, the first one was amazing, has great storylines, for this one it's more like prison fight movie than an escape one, but still it's not very bad, but it could be better like the first one. personally I did enjoy watching it because of the fight scenes.

reviews.review_title: Pretty good in a 1980s action movie way
reviews.content: I saw the first Escape Plan recently by mistake and found myself enjoying it. This is very similar to the first. In many ways it is quite a nostalgic nod to the action movies of the 80s and 90s. The acting is really terrible and the plot makes no sense "why imprison people when you could just get rid of them?" but try not to overthink it. The action sequences are pretty good and it was again quite enjoyable

So I thought I've just watched the first escape plan so let's roll into the second. What a mistake. I'm only twenty minutes in and it's a total mess. Don't waste your time. Stick to the first one then walk away.

reviews.review_title: I thought this sequel was actually better than the original
reviews.content:
Although that isn't saying an awful lot. Despite its very interesting premise the first film was very silly on occasion and made Arny and Sly look their age (unlike the Expendables franchise).
We do get a new action star, in Xiaoming Huang, and the concept of the inescapable prison is taken further, although the criterion for who should be locked up is decidedly shaky. But that's always the rub with prisons isn't it.
Perhaps it's time for a prison movie that actually questions the logic of keeping criminals in free board and accommodation (and increasingly generous facilities) while the taxpayers who are covering those costs have to work hard to obtain the same things. Surely there has to be some cost/benefit analysis so it doesn't become incarceration just for the sake of keeping criminals away from society?

reviews.review_title: The bridge section of this kind of black prison, with one may still have a good look, with two is to laugh at the audience's intelligence quotient.
reviews.content: The bridge section of this kind of black prison, with one may still have a good look, with two is to laugh at the audience's intelligence quotient. What's more, there's no escaping plot in this film. Does fighting find a place, breaking into the system and opening the door, and thinking about prison layouts in the middle are used to delay time? Huang Xiaoming is really the guarantee of bad movies. His distinctive accent and dull close-up expression are enough.

Follows a few years after the first film. Escape artist Ray Breslin (Stallone) has taken a step down from field work choosing to teach new recruits his techniques. It follows Ray Breslin's protege who is imprisoned in a high tech prison run by robots. They are forced to fight each other in a Mortal Kombat style dojo in order to gain rations. It's full of stupid moments that makes the first film look like a masterpiece. It repeats a lot things from that film from a set-up fight used as a distraction to a poorly conceived twist reveal towards the end. The digital effects look shoddy as if they were made using an iTunes app and the editing is wonky in places. It rips off films like Tron Legacy and The Hunger Games making it feel like a cheap looking parody. The film is let down by a lame set up, predictable plot, bland characters and lazy writing. Don't let the film mislead you into thinking this is a Stallone/Bautista actioner as they are only in it for about 15 minutes. Instead it focuses on unknown actors who are not very good at acting (which is most likely because they used to be MMA fighters). The director does an okay job directing some of the action scenes, some of them are well choreographed however they suffer from the dreaded shaky-cam where we can barely see what is going on. The film could have been a lot better if it was backed by a proper production company. It just looks cheaply produced as if it was made by a bunch of incompetent film students. It's let down by a bad story, a slow pace and lack of character development. In the end it's a loud, dumb fun guilty pleasure that (thankfully) runs at 90 minutes.
It is so, so worse, so humiliating to its part 1 and Sylvester Stallone that it needs to deleted from every database in the world, so those who have not watched it yet be save from mental agony.

The only thing I thought about watching this movie was how much Stallone's diction has improved. He must have spent a lot of time working with a voice coach to improve so greatly over the years. His diction was great, his acting was horrible, the only thing I can think of is that maybe at his age and as hard as he's been on his body that he might have terrible arthritis and he's in a lot of pain. I sure felt his pain watching this movie. I liked the original Escape Plan, it was an interesting story. This was not interesting, It didn't really have a story although there was an attempt to teach a moral lesson. None of the actors were memorable, the dialogue was totally forgettable as well. I just felt pity for Stallone, he looked so old and he's still trying to do action pics well past his prime. He kind of reminds me of Brett Favre neither one of them could face the fact that their glory days are behind them and instead of staying out of the spotlight they crave just 1 more score. I don't understand it, if you have the money why not retire when you're on top and let your legend speak for you? It's crap like this that tarnishes what you used to be. If you're a big Stallone fan and you feel like you have to see this movie, wait a month it will be on Netflix. I promise you're going to be disappointed.
Really poor dont bother watch the first again or Rambo first blood

reviews.review_title: Different from the first one but decent.
reviews.content: The first Escape Plan had a huge order in having both Stallone and Schwarzenegger as the main stars. It ended being a competent movie that left a lot to be desired from its main cast especially lacking action. For the sequel gone is Arnold and even Stallone kinda take a backseat. The movie is mostly about Xiaoming Huang's character Shu. As for Batista? He is in the movie even less than Stallone. Its pretty obvious they where going for a much smaller budget this time and it show. Even if the prison is more high tech in a way than the one in the first movie, it does seem much cheaper made. What for me tought saved the movie was Xiaoming Huang action scenes. The dude is pretty good at martial arts and weird enough, you could almost consider this sequel to Escape Plan as a martial arts movie.I think the fans of Stallone will be a bit disapointed and maybe even the fans of Batista, as there role are much smaller than the cover poster would let you believe, but if you can pass over that and apreciate the movie for what it is, and if you enjoy on screen martial arts, i think you should had a good time with this movie.

reviews.review_title: I didn't expect such as this great movie
reviews.content: I don't care about director and camera i care about the story and the actors and it was amazing i like so much stallone movies.

reviews.review_title: You get what you pay for!
reviews.content:
Escape Plan 2I'm a huge Stallone fan.
In fact I consider Sly to be my favourite movie star.
So when the opportunity to rent his latest offering became available for a mere 99p I jumped at the chance.
But just like the saying goes
"You get what you pay for!"Escape Plan 2 is a dire film.
By far the worst of Stallone's career. I'm talking even worse than 'Stop or my Mom will shoot!'
This sequel to 2013's surprisingly entertaining original is a pointless affair.
Escape Plan's USP was the teaming up of Sly and Arnie to deliver a good old 80's style action romp, and boy did they!
Here Arnie is no where insight. Obviously he must have read the script and turned to his buddy and said " No Sly, Don't do it!
Get to the chopper!"I have absolutely no idea what the plot is of this latest instalment because the acting is so bad it detracts from the story telling.
Even Sly is terrible!
I can't believe I'm saying this! Sly you're my hero but c'mon! How can you go from a Golden Globe and a Oscar nomination straight to this?
Stallone has made some poor career choices in the past regarding choosing roles and projects to work on, but this one is a new low. There's absolutely nothing positive to say about this film.The action scenes are poorly staged and CGI is abysmal. There's an explosion at the beginning of the movie that looks laughably bad.
Direction has no direction.
Dialogue is hilariously cheesy.
Editing has been done by a three year old with kitchen scissors...The list goes on.Due to Arnie's absence the film makers have managed to rope in Dave Bautista as a replacement but both he and Stallone take a back seat in this movie leaving most of the film to a bunch of Hollywood Z listers.
Honestly I just don't understand why this film exists. The fact that there's a third instalment on the way is mind boggling.In all honesty I couldn't sit through the entirety of this terrible film.
I gave up when Bautista turned to Sly and asked
"Is it good to be back?"
To which Sly replies "No it's bad to be back!"
That was me done like a Christmas turkey. I hit the stop button, my hero had fallen from grace!
What so now you're stooping so low as to take Arnie's line and adapt it?
C'mon Sly you can't do this to me!
I hope with all my heart that my favourite movie star of all time redeems himself in Creed 2 because Escape Plan 2 is the worst film of his magnificent career!

reviews.review_title: I don't know what this is
reviews.content: Wierd movie, great actors. Still a stupid movie. Dumb graphics.

Bigger, better, badder prison, no Arnie, less Sly. Features martial arts fighting. Ex-employee Breslin creates a prison based on computer algorithms. This is a mindless action film that is open for a sequel. Action is predictable and so was the dialogue as I was saying the dialogue out load like a Rocky Horror Show ...except I was hearing it for the first time. Legion was an interesting character(s) that was never developed. Guide; F-word. No sex or nudity even with a bachelor party in Bangkok. No prison showers.

reviews.review_title: What a fun action movie should be!
reviews.content: Don't let the haters and 1 stars sway you! This movie has Sly doing what Sly does best, Bautista kicking a**, 50cent playing it cool and Xiaoming Huang adding another dimension and great fight skills to a cool prison break film.
Disjointed, made no sense, confusing plot leaps. Avoid.

I can barely hear what the actors are saying it's so low And Stallone sounds like he's talking through a mouth full of marbles. Blurbell blurbell. The martial arts is fun to watch but the rest is garbage. The female characters are there for sheer t&a and barely noticeable.

reviews.review_title: can anything be worse than this ?
reviews.content:
A Chinese movie with Sylvester Stallone in it.
wish i never saw it.

The first film wasn't the most original in the world, either, as a clone of so many other escape films, but at least it has its own quirks that made it relatable. Escape Plan 2 is like a sequel created by a computer algorithm, which is funny, because it is about a computer algorithm controlling the "yet another most advanced prison in the world". And it's more a Chinese film now, than an American one. Don't get me wrong, I liked that part, with the martial arts and the Sun Tzu like thinking. Only it was also really badly made as a story. It felt like a compilation of all the cinematics in a video game put on YouTube. The game would have been interesting, but it doesn't exist, while the cinematics are just like one would expect: rushed and not relatable.Bottom line: if you started watching it, you probably like escape movies, so you will enjoy this, maybe. But look at the great cast: Stalone, Bautista, Wes Chatham (Amos from The Expanse), Xiaoming Huang (with great martial prowess)... even 50 Cent as a dorky hacker... ahem... Anyway, that potential was totally wasted in this film. And the escape itself? A clumsy, confusing affair, that made little sense.

reviews.review_title: Chinese movie and the camera man had epilepsy throughout the movie
reviews.content:
You know it's bad when you are not looking at the screen. The shaky camera man had epilepsy throughout the movie. Had to look away from the screen to save myself a headache. Sylvester Stallone, Dave Bautista and 50 Cent had nothing to do with the movie. This is a pure Chinese movie with a Jackie Chan wannabe as the main actor. There were only 2 main villains and a handful of guards manning this so-called hi-tech prison with low light.Chinese guy: "If we put your face on the poster, will you let us act in the movie?"
Sylvester: "Sure. Do you know US English?"
Chinese guy: "We know Chinese English."
Sylvester: "That's great. The audience will not know the difference."

Watching this sequel after watching the original Escape Plan and having relatively low expectations, considering this film didn't go to theaters and Arnold Schwarzenegger wasn't in it. This sequel isn't completely bad but it's still not great and not on the level of the original.This film doesn't have the charm, cleverness and overall watchable interesting plot as the original. Also Stallone is more of a supporting character in this country one. The action sequences weren't filmed great and the entire plot was predictable. As a rewatch 08/15/22' opinions remain same. Some decent action but overall not as good or enjoyable as the original.

Just happened across this one showing on TV, I like Stallone so gave it a go. Plot is pretty silly and some of the CGI look cheap. Could have done with subtitles whenever 50 Cents mumbled his lines. And what's with all the PINK going on? It's EVERYWHERE! Sly looks a bit old for this sort of thing now but still good to see him. And there is plenty of impressive martial arts to keep it reasonably interesting. Will check out the first movie in due course.

We always here that sequels are worst than the first one, and most of the time it's true but Escape 2:hades was a different, it wasnt a typical sequel. We had new players in the game, that made it seem like the original. I was pleasantly surprise by Stallone and the other actors. None of it was cheesy, funny, and the script went well with each scene. I wanted more at the end, and I'm glad they are in post production for Escape 3. I would definitely watch this movie again. I think if you give it chance you'll find it enjoyable.

The movie itself is pretty boring, The main issue was the start of it was very good, but after they get trapped that is the boring stuff. Nothing really happens, entire feeling of the film is off. Also the cook looked like a girl with that blindfold on so I thought I was about to see some nasty stuff for a minute going down, turned out I was wrong lol. Prisons design is cool and I liked the robots.Over-all it's alright to see once but I can't imagine watching this over again, what would be the point? Escape Plan 1 was so much better.
Every fight scene was horrible to watch, the picture shakes too much, you can't make any sense of it. The plot was just awful and predictable.

Escape Plan 2 will be a disappointment for many considering Sly is'nt in this much and has a supporting role. The lead of the film is a Chinese actor named Xioming Huang, which works out fine as his acting is pretty decent and his fighting skills are good. I was wondering why this did'nt hit theaters here in the US, I guess that is why. Bautista's got limited screen time as well, but his performance is memorable. This is in no way an equal to the 1st film, but for what it is, it is not bad at all. Escape Plan 2 is a bit more sci fi then the original film, but in a lot of ways it is similar and uses the same formula. You certainly could do a lot worst for direct to video action and some action movies that did go the theater, this is a lot better than Expendables 3 in my opinion.

I love everything Stallone and really want Bautista to succeed as both are awesome but this just felt a bit naff, it's like Tron Legacy mixed with Escape plan 1 but done badly. I hate not watching a movie all the way through especially as the actors were all good, fight scenes decent, Stallone did his part but it's one of a handful of movies I switched off half way through.
Hate the movie. Only thing lifting it up from one are the actors. Need an escape plan for this movie!

reviews.review_title: Starts of slow, but like mold it grows on you
reviews.content: I'm giving this a 10 not because I think it's really a 10, but to help offset some of the very low reviews. I think this is more of a 6-8, but not as bad as many have stated. 15 minutes in I was thinking, what the heck am I watching. This is not at all like the first escape plan, in fact Stalone plays a minor role at least initially, so much so, that I was feeling this was just a way for the studio to make a quick buck off of the first escape plan and billing it as another Stalone movie. Even the opening scene is much more gritty than the first, almost like Zero dark thirty. I started thinking maybe they are trying to go for a higher caliber setup, but then seemed to fissile for a bit. However if you sit through it, it's more of a chess game. Sure there are plenty of plot holes and if you blink things can get confusing, however, the acting is pretty good and the overall plot and twists are enough to carry it through. Overall I ended up enjoying the movie and getting into it much more than I expected from the opening. The ending is a layup for another movie, which I immediately suspected would not happen as I know many will not like this movie at all. However, I an see on IMDB that #3 is already in the works and yes I will plan to see it, albeit maybe when it's on video, guess we'll see.

reviews.review_title: You can really tell they weren't trying
reviews.content: In the first couple of minutes of this movie you can tell how much effort were willing to put into it. The bullet special effects are ridiculous; like something you would see in a very low budget television show, and there is even a part where someone (I seriously can't remember a single persons name from this movie) gets electrocuted and I actually laughed when I saw the special effects for the electricity. There is simply no excuse for how poor the effects are, I really want to stress that because it's freaking 2018 for crying out loud. CGI should be practically indistinguishable from reality at this point in time. However, what we get instead is a complete backwards tumble to CGI from the year 2000.But enough about the effects. Let's talk about the movie itself. The entire thing is expositional. Each scene exists in a linear fashion and serves no other purpose than to terribly propel the plot. There is no downtime for character progression. There is no progression. There is just "I guess we need to put a scene here, so let's just regurgitate the first thing that comes to our mind." Half this movie is over before you even realize it. It's like a machine gun firing on full auto in terms of how fast the scenes are presented to the viewer. It's almost like the creators wanted the scenes to go by quickly just to keep people from noticing how crappy the story is-or keep them from realizing there is no story. "These people need to fight each other for REASONS, why? Shut your mouth and give us your money!Look, I enjoyed the first movie. I thought it was actually a decent film. However, I really don't know what the hell happened in this. I even jokingly predicted that the next movie was going to be in Outer Space, and apparently that actually turned out to be true, because it's already in development. That's not a good thing. I shouldn't be able to jokingly predict your next move, while thinking of the stupidest idea that I possibly can. The fact that I was correct about it, is just an insult to your intelligence as writers and directors.Giving this a 1/10 and no that's not at all harsh. This movie should not exist. And until someone can explain to me why it does exist, my rating will stay at a 1.

reviews.review_title: Pretty routine Stallone action fun, so I enjoyed it!
reviews.content: 'ESCAPE PLAN 2: HADES': Three Stars (Out of Five)A sequel to the 2013 action flick 'ESCAPE PLAN'. Star Sylvester Stallone returns as a security expert who must enter an inescapable prison yet again, in order to rescue one of his team who's trapped there. Dave Bautista replaces Arnold Schwarzenegger in this sequel, while Huang Xiaoming, Wes Chatham, Jesse Metcalfe, Jaime King, Chen Tang and Titus Wellive also join the cast. 50 Cent reprises his role from the original movie as well. It was directed by Steven C. Miller and it was written by Miles Chapman (who also co-wrote the first film). The movie was released directly to video in the U.S., and it's gotten mostly negative reviews from critics. I found it to be mostly entertaining. Ray Breslin (Stallone) has built a new team of security experts. One of them has lost his trust though, Jaspar Kimbral (Chatham), so he fires him. Shortly later, another one of Ray's team, named Shu (Xiaoming), goes missing. Ray believes he's being held in a new inescapable fortress like prison. So he gets himself locked up again, in order to get his friend out. The movie is pretty routine Stallone action fun, so I enjoyed it. Once again, he's casting an ensemble of younger (and hipper) actors as his costars though. I'm fine with that here. Still, as I look back at the movie now, it definitely wasn't that good (I realize now). I did like it while I was watching it though, and I'd definitely still recommend it to a Stallone movie fan.

reviews.review_title: More purgatory than Hades I am afraid.
reviews.content:
Escape Plan 2: Hades: 3 out of 10: Sylvester Stallone runs a firm that breaks people out of prison. After a job goes bad the team breaks up only to be brought back together when a new secret prison, the titular Hades, threatens one of their own. The Good: Dave Bautista is fun for the three minutes or so he is in the movie.
 
I also like the way the sets are a throwback to the Full Moon pictures of the 1980's with all the neon and bad special effects. The Bad: Dave Bautista is the only fun interesting character in the movie. The way he has been arguing with Disney we may see him in a lot more direct to video films like this. His loss is honestly our gain.The movie Cube managed a much more effective future prison look on a much smaller budget twenty years ago. I found the sets and special effects hilariously bad. I am not sure the filmmakers really meant that.The Ugly: To say this movie's plot makes no sense is an understatement. The futuristic prison contains advanced technology (healing robots, virtual reality etc) that is certainly more profitable to market to the outside world than the current kidnap people and makes them fight so they will reveal the industrial secrets business plan. It is like one of those movies where the bad guy invents a ray that can control the weather and then decided to use it to rob a bank.In Conclusion: I have not seen the first Escape Plan but I understand it isn't that bad a movie. Why they thawed out Sylvester Stallone for this junk I have no idea. This is clearly one of those international co-productions meant for foreign audiences. This is not always a bad thing. Bloodrayne is an awful movie filled with international stars but it is also a fun movie filled with sex, violence and hammy acting. This honestly has no action, nudity or violence. Just a bunch of nobodies wandering around a set from 1980's The Apple while some American stars pop in for glorified cameos. More purgatory than Hades I am afraid.
Terrible movie, terrible acting, crap storyline and to be honest I have nothing decent to say about this movie, avoid it at all costs - utterly pathetic!

This is one of those few movies which are better than the first. Interesting plot incorporating cyber hacks, good chemistry between the (some of the) actors, and I like how the story switches from one to the other - within and without the prison. I am surprised by the negative reviews - perhaps having the 2 Chinese actors in the movie (with "bad English") playing key roles did not sit well with the American audience (Asian actors are often stereotyped playing minor/sidekick roles)?
Lots of quick shots, confusing narration, two similar looking characters ... and I got confused but stuck through this. Though not by much, Stallone and Bautista saved it from being a complete bomb.

reviews.review_title: "VISUALLY STUNNING ACTION THRILLER" A MILLION TIMES BETTER THAN PT3!!! ONE COOL ACTION FILM.
reviews.content:
Escape plan 2: Hades, the straight to dvd sequel to the Awesome "Schwarzenegger" & "Stallone" team-up action prison Thriller "Escape plan" & this flick has a stunning look, it's a futuristic-noir kung-fu action Thriller & "Stallone" is not the main lead here, "Ray Breslin" has a new younger team with "Jesse Metcalfe" "Dave Bautista" "Wes Chatham" & new main lead in the excellent & tough as hell "Huang Xiaoming" & this guy is great, he is a fantastic fighter & makes an excellent brutal action hero!!!
To round out the "Expendables" style cast we also have "Curtis Jackson" back as "Hush" & "Jaime King" as "Abigail" both who appeared in the first film.
This story is about one of there own who turns "bad" & sets his old team mates up & locks them up in a brutal futuristic prison, this new lock-up is mesmerising to look at with it's colourful glowing neon lights everywhere like something out of "Tron" or "Blade runner" & with the Awesome pulsing electronic score that's straight out of the 80's sci-fi genre it's actually a really good well made action film, the fight scenes are excellent & brutal with blood & grit.
This is actually one of the Coolest Action movies I've seen in a long time, there's something raw & retro about this sequel, the hypnotic lights & music completely sucked me into this dark & dangerous prison world, the visuals are stunning, often the film feels so dark with it's tough 80's style tone & moody atmosphere, it's an excellent low-budget movie & it's fine that "Mr.Ego-Stallone" is a bit part here because the younger team are an interesting bunch.A very good movie considering it's a straight to dvd sequel to a big budget cinema released film, Escape Plan 2 tries to be completely different from it's original & at that it succeeded, it's obviously not better than the brilliant first film but it's a million times better than the more dull & boring 3rd film, I'm surprised to hear that "Stallone" doesn't like part 2 at all & considers part 3 to be way better? Know idea how? Or why?
Escape plan 3: Hades is a visually stunning sci-fi action Thriller made by what seems to be a visionary director, I'm going by the excellent style of this film, "Stallone" is good as "Ray Breslin" again but he's not the big main part & maybe that's why he didn't like it? Because in part 3 it's more his lead role again!!!
Oh i have to say that i was impressed with "Jesse Metcalfe" in an action role, he's actually really good & is one of the better characters of the movie!!!
Anyway i really enjoyed part 2 & it was a good choice giving the main lead part to "Huang" as Shu Ren, the guy is a total tough nut & a good moody & ready to strike action lead.
I think it is a decent movie,what I expected I got,I didn't expect it to be Creed just good action flick.

The first Escape Plan movie is simply fun, intense and a great call back to 90's action film, starring two of the biggest 90's action star: Sylvester Stallone and Arnold Schwarzenegger. This one, nope! Confusing plot, bad direction, and overall, it's a snooze! Well, one might argue that this movie is straight-to-DVD, well I'll argue back that it has a theatrical release in my place so might as well rating it like an actual movie in an actual theater.Yup, the movie still sucks.Pros:
Stallone, Bautista, and 50 CentSylvester Stallone once again did a good job as Ray Breslin though he did just a quarter of what he did in the first Escape Plan. Dave Bautista although also didn't get much to do, did a good job as DeRosa. Lastly, Curtis "50 Cent" Jackson did a good job as Hush the hacker.Production design/set piecesThe production design is great in this movie. All set pieces looked great for a straight-to-DVD movie. The lighting looks great. The neon futuristic look also looks good.Cons:
Characters*sigh* where should I start...
This movie is just a giant paycheck for everyone. Stallone isn't even the main character! He didn't do much in the movie until literally the 3rd act. Bautista is wasted in this movie, he doesn't even appear in the movie for more than 10 minutes. The "main character", which is Shu, played by Huang Xiaoming isn't as charismatic, nor as interesting as Ray. This movie felt like a "passing the torch" movie, and that kinda felt forced. The main baddie in the villain, had no motivation in this movie other than revenge, and he's really terrible! There's also this one lady who looks like cheap Margot Robbie knock-off. The supporting characters weren't even memorable, we don't even had a proper introduction to them! No names, no backstory, nothing! (other than Shu has a sibling and the banter between them, and that's it!)PlotThere's doesn't even a plot in this movie. It's confusing, it's dreadful and it's horrible. There's no depth in the story, it's just some corporation who wants this tech, and some revenge plan along with it! That's it! That's the movie! Some plot points also don't make sense, and some crucial scenes I believe were either cut from the movie, or just, y'know, too lazy to even filmed it.CGIIt looks like a low-budget fantasy drama on my local TV station. It's looks horrible, some were good, but overall it's bad. Even the explosions were CGI! C'mon, does Lionsgate afraid to shell out a couple hundred thousand dollars for a decent explosion?CinematographySome were stunning, the rest were bad. The fight scenes involves your usual vomit-inducing shakey cam and quick cuts. You even have a guy who clearly knows Wing Chun (Chinese martial arts), and clearly knows how to fight, so why there's still shakey cams?!EditingThe editors clearly doesn't know how to edit a movie. They could have just follow the plot in chronological order, but nope, they jumbled the scenes to make the already confusing movie even more confusing.Overall, Escape Plan 2 is confused, unfocused and a horrible sequel to a perfectly fine action-thriller movie. This movie is clearly a simple cash grab. It doesn't deserve your money, it doesn't deserve your time, all you get from watching this movie, is a good 90 minutes long nap. What a shame.
Big star cast but nothing much inside the story.. u expect each time something big is going to happen but nothing happens.. the movie so predictable
Sylvester Stallone and Dave Bautista help out one really talented Chinese fighter/actor and 2 bearded guys it took me a while to tell apart.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as many people say it is
reviews.content: This movie is currently rated 3,7 here on imdb. Many people giving it 1 star reviews. Seriously ? Alot of people seriously think this movie is worse than the worst of Steven Seagal movies ? Let me put it straight; its not ! Im a long time Sylvester Stallone fan and I loved the first Escape Plan (2013). I waited a long time to watch this movie because I heard its supposed to be the worst movie in movie history. But now that I have watched ut...twice...I must say that I was actually pleasantly surprised. I enjoyed it. Yes, its made on a low budget. But they made the most out of the bucks...it looks ok for the most part (minus a terrible cgi explosion in the beginning wtf). They made the top secret prison facility look really cool...loved the robot. Think Running man ! Actually the stylish look of the movie and the very, very cool (!) retro 80's synth score makes this a fun and cool B-movie experience. The style, score and overall atmosphere reminds me somewhat of Beyond the black rainbow (something I never expected of a Sly movie). I was even surprised Sly had as much screentime as he did...he was a major part of the movie, eventhough not as much as in the original. I must admit he does come across as a little tired and uninterested...he does seem to phone it in little, probably not the most exciting project he was ever part of. But he is a professional and delivers ok. The story, characters and the flow of the story...could have been better for sure. Its not a 10 star movie, but Im giving it 10 to balance all the ridiculous 1 star reviews. If you are a fan of stylish cyberpunk B-movies you might want to give it a chance.

reviews.review_title: Not an average prison movie, but an average movie in general
reviews.content: I think the main reason this movie ended out underwhelming is that Stalone and Batista have secondary roles at best. It's not easy to compete with the pair Stalone + Arnold especially when the cast does not include big or established names outside of them. Main characters feel shallow, the prison is too futuristic and the mechanisms feel too complex and not like a prison at all as it's more about the Arena than the cells and the system itself. The flow is kind of confusing for the viewer and the plot is not deep at all. It's good that the movie is 1 and a half hour long. Action movies usually should not be more more than 100'. The fighting scenes are okay and enjoyable for the casual fan. Some of the dialogue and the escape sequences can be considered fun.✍ It's a decent movie at best, but watchable nevertheless. You might enjoy it yet not get filled by enthusiasm, every film needs the proper expectations. If this one did not act like a clickbait with the major names being promoted, maybe it would have done better because the hype hurted it but it's not that bad after all. Just nothing special. 5.5/10
Even for free please do not watch this, it's full of plotholes and the acting and CG are total garbage. I gave up after 40 minutes, use your time to do ANYTHING else.

First of all, this is a scifi, not an action thriller, and it's not a good one.
The soldiers aren't believable, any rook with basic training can see that they're handling themselves poorly at best, with regards to handling weapons, tacticts, communication and more.
And most annoying of all is that the audience is being treated as idiots, by having chinese people speak english to one another, which makes NO sense and ruins what little immersion there is, making ou have to "re-set" when the patronizing whitewash finally ends.
If you manage to get past that, there's decent hand to hand fight scenes, but apart from that, most of the action is pure scifi, again, ruining immersion.
I like most of Stallone's movies including the prequel to this shlock, and Batista has become one of my favorite actors,and I DID enjoy the scenes with the two together, but that doesn't rescue this accident of a movie, because the plot is all over the place, the cinematography is bad and so is the editing, and did I mention CHINESE PEOPLE SPEAKING ELNGLISH TO EACH OTHER..?
It gets a 2 for the few good scenes, I was tempted to give a 1..

It's a straight-to-video actioner from Stallone. What the hell were you expecting?I personally enjoyed it. I embraced the fairly cheesy story, slightly hammy acting, (by my standards), and Chinese glamour influences because it's an effing straight-to-video actioner from Stallone!It has: fairly clever plotting, (though predictable), some ok fight scenes, (though all done with closeups and multiple cuts, and probably some cgi during some of the fights), and a few decent moments from Stallone and Bautista, who both received top billing, even though the actual star is some dude named Huang Xiaoping who's probably huge in China, but who's ESL classes must have just wrapped right before filming, (either that or he went with the Jackie Chan method and just learned how to say his English language lines), because his Chinese accent is really intense, and it's wirth noting that Stallone and Bautista probably completed all their scenes on a slow Tuesday, because they're probably in less than a third of the flick.This movie has everything you'd expect from a movie you probably paid $1.75 for at the Redbox. Anyone who paid the $6 on iTunes or Vudu is just a dum bass, for sure. Go to the Redbox and get some popcorn. It's really not as bad as has been reported. Also, the Redbox disc is a double feature with the admittedly superior original Escape Plan, so it's kind of a no-brainer, really.

reviews.review_title: Haha. Laughably bad. But still not funny.
reviews.content: There's not much to be said here. This is a straight up money grab, though I'm not sure whose money they are actually grabbing. Not mine.Anything you remember from the original you might as well toss out the window. This movie is as B-level as you get, possibly C. Remember those direct to DVD Steven Seagal movies? This one is right up those trash buckets' alley. Stallone and "The Animal" Dave Bautista have secondary roles at best. If I had to count, I'd say Dave utters, maybe, 8-9 lines the entire movie, none of which are interesting or memorable. The movie itself is so ridiculous, illogical, and scattered. There's no substantial plot, no real point to what little plot exists beyond that unsubstantial mess, and anything remaining is as cheap and low-grade as you get. The entire movie is full of throwaway characters. When you do watch this, just count on six hands how many characters are in the movie yet have no actual point what so ever. For fun, I'll give you a quick start:The blonde/brunette girl who OooOoOoooOOs at the beginning, in the truck (maybe ... Abigail?).The brunette girl who works for Stallone (maybe ... Abigail?).The blonde girl who works for Stallone (maybe ... Abigail?).The 3 Legion HackersThe Scar-Faced African GangsterThe girlfriend of the main Jet Li's "brother"JESSE METCALFE (I mean, I'm laughing as I type this, but I'm still trying to figure out WHAT exactly his entire point in the film was. Thinking, thinking, thinking, deep in my mind, and still can't figure it out. The guy is next to useless, beyond so, even, and comes off as just a helpless puppy in the movie who is there just to make the other main characters seem more useful). Dave Bautista You could even argue 50 Cent, but I guess he does have a purpose in the film, and at leas this character contributes something, even as ridiculous as it is.Apparently this Hades prison has no ability to stop wave-based signals either, for 2-way audio communication works just fine in this electrified floor setting. Really, the entire prison is a joke. It's security, its layout, its prisoners, the way its ran, the way the prisoners work ... none of it has any thought behind outside a couple of screen writers who drew the story out on a napkin over lunch. It is that shallow. Let's not even talk about the abysmmal "shakey-cam" all of these trash A-C level action movies have started abusing for the past 15 years. Or the lack of direction. Or the awful script. The poor dialogue. The vacant acting. The amateur cinematography...There is no redeeming qualities to this movie--at all. You will watch it, you will (maybe) finish it. Subsequently, immediately, you will forget it after giving it a bad review, then proceed to delete it from your hard drive. AWFUL.

reviews.review_title: Smh @ people who say this is the worst movie ever...
reviews.content: Clearly these people have not seen a fraction of the bad films out there. First thing to know is that this was a straight-to-DVD movie. In 2018 what this really tells you is that the official release was not in the US -- who still watches DVDs in the US? A little bit of research will tell you that this was mostly financed by Chinese investors, which is why the main star of the movie is Chinese. Basically the story is Chinese with foreign actors that were filmed in China, yet then some filming with the Escape Plan actors was filmed in the US and then integrated into the movie. Are the US actors and foreign actors ever on the same screen with each other? If so it is limited. Knowing this, you should compare this movie with other movies of the same caliber... Chinese action/martial arts movies. The "Escape Plan" skin is just to give it some credibility in the US with minimal effort by the US actors. This is very common in sequels that aim to setup a franchise.... Stallone announced a 3rd movie and it will most likely be a great movie if it is based in the US and not as liked in China, or a great movie if based in China and not as liked in the US. Either he wants to be serious with the franchise (which we will know how serious if he, 50-Cent, and Bautista are in the next film). All of this being the case here, one should watch this movie out of the eyes of a fan of 80's action beat-em-up mixed with 90's action martial-arts mixed with cheap fX, older action stars that don't move around that much anymore because they are like 80 years old (yeah, seriously.... can you do backflips even at 55??), and the introduction of new actors/actresses in hopes that they can make a career and Stallone can make some money off of the whole thing. The dude is brilliant when it comes to creating and maintaining franchises and stretches them out for decades to make millions and millions of dollars---- Rocky (with the new film coming out this year it will be 42 years of movies), Rambo (with the new film coming out in 2019 it will be 37 years of movies), The Expendables has been running 9 years already with the new movie slated for next year, Escape Plan will be on its 6th year next year, and don't forget that Stallone owned the late 80's early 90's action genre with roughly 10 blockbuster movies that made almost a billion dollars combined. What does all of this say??? It says that he knows what he is doing as an actor and as a film maker. Having a little bit of understanding how Hollywood operates it is easy to see that this movie isn't really Escape Plan: Hades.... it is Escape Plan in China: Hades. This movie is easily a 5 star movie. If you love Stallone you will like this movie. If you love 50-Cent you will enjoy his cameos. And if you like Chinese martial arts with very colorful gadgetry (ever been to Asia?!) then you will really like this movie. The movie is not a 1 star. But it is not a 10 either. Somewhere in the middle is just.

reviews.review_title: A complete nonsense of a movie
reviews.content:
Another one of those sequel movies where the initial movie was somewhat decent or had success, so the producers (or whoever was in charge) thought it would be a good idea to make another one about basically the same thing and it turns out to be a disaster. "Shocker"! I actually somewhat liked the first 'Escape Plan' movie starring Sylvester Stallone and Arnold Schwarzenegger. It was nothing brilliant, but at least it had some entertainment value.The same can't be said about the sequel, though. Many would give up after about 20-30 mins, but I decided to see how low its score would drop on the scale by the end of it. Well, the answer is: very low.First of all, the plot and the writing is terrible - the story and the opening sequences make little to no sense. At one point I just gave up on trying to make any sense out of it and just wanted to see the "brilliant" conclusion, which was (unsurprisingly) weak and felt rushed, but at that point I was happy it was over. All of this is only made worse by the awful acting. If you just look at the names on the cast you might find some well-known names like Dave Bautista, Jaime King and Jesse Metcalfe, but it's all a trap. I wonder if they now regret having this movie on their résumé. Throughout the movie the acting is so stiff that it just doesn't bring any interest in any of the characters. The viewer just never really cares or roots for the supposed good guys nor despises the actions of the bad guys that's how plain they are.In this sequel Sylvester Stallone is back playing Ray Breslin - one of the main guys of the first movie, however the role of his character is diminished to the point where he might be better off being left out of it. But even if he had the main role, it wouldn't help much to save this movie. It just feels that Sylvester is getting too old for this action/tough guy business - we've just seen too many of these already.Setting aside the acting part, I actually found the camera work to be decent for my taste, unfortunately in the final cut it's meshed with some poor CGI, which spoils the only thing that might be considered positive about this movie.In short recap, yes, you can find some shootouts, a car chase and plenty of fight scenes in the movie, but it's all just one big, MEH! It's an empty shell with no substance.
If you haven't seen the first movie then I'd recommend watching that one instead, otherwise - avoid!

Back in 2013, Sylvester Stallone and Arnold Schwarzenegger co-starred in Swedish director Mikael Håfström's intelligent, suspenseful, white-knuckled, Houdini-esque epic "Escape Plan" about an expert who breaks out of prisons for a living. A former criminal prosecutor who became a prison security expert, Stallone played Ray Breslin, a past master at escaping from the most foolproof prisons. Wardens dreaded the prospect that he would undermine their elaborate security procedures, so that he could crash out. Mind you, "Escape Plan" broke no records, eventually coining a mere $137 million worldwide. Nevertheless, not only did the producers must have faith in Sly, but also the Chinese box office. Produced at a cost of $20-million, "Escape Plan 2: Hades" has coined almost $14 million in China. Presumably, the American release will add to the coffers. Basically, "Escape Plan 2" is barely half as good as its impeccably produced predecessor. Many things have changed. First, Schwarzenegger doesn't reprise his role as Rottmayer. Since he didn't work for Breslin's company, Rottmayer had no real narrative reason to return. Second, Dave Bautista appears in a cameo as a member of Sly's team. About "Escape Plan 2," Bautista has said, "It's completely different than "Escape Plan one. It's a different vibe, a different look. Obviously, I'm coming in and filling in the gap Arnold left . . ." Third, Ray Breslin himself spends more time shuffling papers than shooting ruffians. "Aggression Scale" director Steven C. Miller orchestrates a smartly-staged bar room shootout for Breslin. Nevertheless, he has others perform the grunt work. Basically, younger hands-- Chinese actor Xiaoming Huang of "Ip Man 2" and Jesse Metcalfe of "John Tucker Must Die"-conduct the heavy lifting. Curtis "50 Cent" Jackson reprises his role as the computer nerd Hush. More accurately, you could describe "Escape Plan 2" as "Escape Plan: The Next Generation," because Stallone shows up about every twelve to fifteen minutes to stir the pot. Meanwhile, "Bosch's" Titus Welliver plays a role like Jim Caviezel's prison warden in the previous movie. Jaime King is on hand momentarily in a role that resembles Amy Ryan's far larger role in the original "Escape Plan."Before he penned "Escape Plan," scenarist Miles Chapman wrote the story and screenplay to 2006's "Road House 2: Last Call," so he knows something about budgetary sequels. The interesting thing about Chapman's script is the way he has moved protagonist Ray Breslin (Sylvester Stallone) smoothly from life & death field activities to daily office drudgery. Of course, five years have passed since "Escape Plan." Moreover, Ray had to take over his business after the fate of his treacherous partner Lester Clark (Vincent D'Onofrio of "Full Metal Jacket") in "Escape Plan." "Escape Plan 2" opens with a slam-bang, prison break as a hostage drama unravels in a scummy Chechen lock-up. Our heroes are trapped in a prison where they've been sent to rescue some women, and the deadline elapses. Everything about this opener is supercharged for maximum suspense. Unfortunately, it is difficult to worry about any of these individuals because we've never seen them before. Literally, they constitute the Next Generation, but IMDB. COM lists none of them as cast members in the forthcoming "Escape Plan 3," currently in post-production. Unfortunately, one of them dies during the breakout because team leader Jaspar Kimbral (Wes Chatham of "The Philly Kid") trusted algorithms rather than his team. Robots versus humans is a staple science fiction theme, and lenser Brandon Cox makes the evil, automated prison known as 'Hades' that our heroes wind up in for most of their shenanigans look like a futuristic sci-fi saga. Ray fires upstart Jaspar for his preference in algorithms over his cohorts. A year later, another of Ray's employees, Shu (Xiaoming Huang) vanishes mysteriously along with his cousin, Yusheng (Chen Tang of "Let's Be Cops"), an ultra-high-tech wizard. Eventually, Breslin and company figure out Shu and Yusheng are being held in a black-site prison, much like 'the Tomb' in "Escape Plan," and Breslin ponders the prospect that it may be a case of payback from his earlier adversaries.The identity of the chief villain nicknamed Galileo should come as no revelation. You'll probably see it coming long before the filmmakers expose this character for his foul play. In some respects, Galileo is incredibly ambitious. Apparently, he has abducted, imprisoned, and tortured those that may yield him the most wealth, treasure, and information. Hades is a state-of-the-art, practically computerized, black-site prison with a robot serving as physician. When Breslin broke out of the prison in "Escape Plan," he persuaded the prison doctor to honor the Hippocratic Oath. Shu generates no influence with the robotic doctor. However, there is no shortage of flesh and blood guards for David Bautista to mow down during the fourth quarter of this 90-minute opus with 4 minutes of end credits. Meantime, Shu is surprised to find Jaspar incarcerated in Hades, too! The second member of Breslin's crew to plunge into the prison is reckless Luke (Jesse Metcalfe), who was chasing down a lead when he was captured. The man who manages the prison, the Zoo Keeper (Titus Welliver), is doing everything to sweat information from Shu's cousin about his number of computer programming patents. When the Zoo Keeper isn't torturing inmates, everybody's favorite pastime in Hades is "Fight Club" style brawls. Obviously, this is one prison that discriminates against the handicapped. Predictably, when the youngsters get themselves into a tight spot, the old man has to enter the arena. Galileo accommodates Breslin when he has him abducted. Trent Derosa (David Bautista of "Spectre") shows up late in the game from the outside like the cavalry.Director Steve C. Miller deserves credit for making this straight-to-video actioneer as palatable as possible. Stallone isn't the star, but he has a couple vigorous, action-packed scenes to keep his arteries from hardening. "Escape Plan 2: Hades" is a tolerable potboiler for anybody but hardcore Stallone aficionados who want to see every single one of his films. Interestingly, Stallone called it the "most horribly produced film" of his career.

reviews.review_title: Horrible and a wasted sequel that is nowhere as good as the first movie.
reviews.content: Escape Plan 2: Hades (1 out of 5 stars). Escape Plan 2 is just pure horrible and nothing can describe why Sylvester Stallone would agree to being in this sequel. The first film was at least decent with him and Arnold Schwarzenegger costarring together and being in a movie were they have to work together to break out a maximum-security prison. However, this sequel fails to live up to the first movie. For starters, this film is a straight to dvd type of movie. You can expect it to be low quality this time. Sylvester Stallone is barely in this movie as well. The plot is lame and dumb. It focuses on Shu Ren (Huang Xiaoming) who works for Breslin's security company and gets captured. And placed in a futuristic prison. Were the owner of the place is known as the zookeeper. And rewards the prisoners if they survive the fights. They have a robotic droid that is a medic in med bay. They have a hologram cell of your preferred setting. Shu is captured cause the owner of the prison wants something from Ren. That involves satellites. While Ray (Sylvester Stallone) and his team Abigail (Jaime King), Hush (Curtis Jackson), and newcomer Luke (Jesse Metcalfe) are trying to get in and to break out with Ren. The plot was all over the place. From the beginning scene was a failed mission of a break out. And a twist that is not as exciting. It was just bad.The direction was horrible. The shootouts were terribly executed. Come on, guys are shooting at each other up front and the bullets are not hitting anyone or anything. It is like they are shooting blanks towards each other. The fight scenes are consisting of close up camera shots and quick editing cuts which does not help make it exciting. Stallone should have passed on this sequel. Dave Bautista was a waste in this role. Appearing for a small amount of screen time. Huang Xiaoming gave a dull performance. Overall, Escape Plan 2: Hades is just pure terrible. A stupid plot. The concept is overkilled with a futuristic prison that has holograms, a rotating prison that changes its layouts, a robotic medic, and force field doors. Yes, it is ridiculous. The action and shootouts are badly executed. And sadly, it does have an ending that leaves for another sequel.

Some Chechnyan terrorists are about the execute some hostages. Among the terrorists is also a Westerner who is tasked with the execution. But then he turns against the terrorists and helps the hostages escape. He also takes the time to destroy their weapons cache, which delays their escape and as a result one of the hostages ends up shot.Back in the US we learn this was an operation run by Breslin (Stallone) who ends up firing the one guy responsible for the delay the in the escape. This guy, Kimbral, was trying to modernize Breslin's operation with algorithms and according to one such algorithm they should have all made it out in time alive even with the destruction of the weapons.Years later, one of Breslin's team members, Shu, is tasked with protecting his brilliant tech-guru cousin. There is an attack and both end up taken prisoners in some high tech prison called HADES. The prison us run by no other than Kimbral but his investors want the technology that Shu's cousin developed so they're torturing him to the get the info. Kimbral developed the prison precisely so that not even Breslin could escape. Meanwhile another guy from the the team is captured and in HADES. So Breslin and 3 or 4 left on his team will have to figured out who to get their friends out, while those one the inside will have to figure out how to escape from a prison with no clear layout with the help of some other convicts. Eventually Breslin himself gets himself imprisoned to get the others out.Not sure Escape Plan ever needed a sequel but it certainly didn't need a C-movie sequel. For the first 20 minutes or so EP2 actually works that is until HADES is introduced. In HADES everything is obnoxiously dark except for some 80s special effects occasionally. It is probably the lamest movie-prison ever shown. How they paid whoever claimed to be a set-designer I don't know. But like all Chinese-coprodutions, this movie doesn't exactly aim for quality and excellence. There are some cool martial-arts scenes but then other action scenes are weak. The only cool thing are some robots since this is an automated AI-run prison. Bautista is in this movie, not kicking butt. Curtis Jackson not sure what his role is here. Escape Plan 2 offers little to the audience.
I sat through this mess, for the life of me I can't remember any part of this. All I can guarantee is that it is horrendous

reviews.review_title: An honest review. Dont even bother reading any of the 1 star reviews

Is this movie spectacular? No
Is it a blockbuster special? No

Some of the cgi was pretty bad, The plot was simple but executed well. I think people read into movies too much these days. If you want a well written poetic 10 star special then dont watch this. If you want an ass kicking prison break movie that you can just turn your brain off for 1 couple of hours then this is the show for you.I was entertained all the way through. It does not deserve the low ratings. Trust me I've watched some horrific films in my time but this doesn't even come close. Watch and choose for yourself.

reviews.review_title: Greatest cinematic masterpiece since Schindler's List and Orson Welles!!
reviews.content: Sylvester Stallone, Dave Bautista, Xiaoming Huang, Jesse Metcalfe, 50 Cent, Wes Chatham and Chen Tang. What else can one ask for?Ladies and gentleman, we are talking Sylvester "Sly" Stallone, an ICON of action movies who, many newcomers movie goers wouldn't know, starred in Rambo, Rocky I-IV and The Specialist along Sharon Stone.Then we have Dave Bautista - brawn meets intellect- where an alpha male the size of Koko the Gorilla solves Rubik's Cube faster than Will Smith's character in Pursuit of Happyness.50 cent stars as a 'sly' ... (get it?) higher-tier consultant or something of the firm and is relatively restrained for all his chutzpah and Crack-A-Bottle soundtrack.The movie portrays, projects and extrapolates what it would be like in futuristic prison. Gone are the days of Salinas County Jail and what not. We have AI-driven, robotics who take care of an entire engine that is called Hades (underground.. see your Greek Mythology).I was a big fan of Stallone in the first Escape Plan where he wrote a dissertation about the structural engineering of the prison and the same intellect, level-headedness, coolness and wit (such as Go scene) is present in the sequel.Each shots are cinematographic masterpiece and not your typical Instagram filters. Sure critics will say the delivery is wooden, or complaint of the ropey dialogue or abrumpt jumping of scenes or lack of storylines and numerous other plotholes... but the end the of the day this is not your average Fast and The Furious meets Prison Break meets Tolstoy's War and Piece.In fact, some of the robotics scene alone is worth the movie entrance and budget of many Hollywood films. Only Hollywood can provide insight and glimpse into superior graphics, visualization and VFX as to what a futuristic prison will look like with hi-tech gadgets.Bravo. Well done folks. Take a bow. It may not be an Oscar material but sure HP Lovecraft, Jules Verse and even Robert Heinlein and Asimov (as in conjoined Robert Heinlein and Asimov in an alterante universe) could have foreshadow'd such master piece.With all aplogies to Shakespeare:If Escape Plan Franchise is the.food of love, play on!!Play on!

reviews.review_title: A Dead Movie to Hades' Liking.
reviews.content: Escape Plan 2: Hades is an awful and hollow bore that plays out like a cheap knock-off of its predecessor. Luckily, movies like this are generally easy to spot from a mile away, long before even watching them, where them being good would be the real and actual surprise, so I had absolutely no high expectations, nor was I disappointed with how terrible this movie is; it was exactly as I figured it would be.Though the first outing, 2013's Escape Plan, was not too bad and rather enjoyable, with Arnold Schwarzenegger adding some authentic charm, 50 Cent was terrible in it, and he continues to be just as abysmal and flat in this instalment. The man simply cannot act, though he can somehow appear palatable to a point where it seems like he is at least alright.Dave Bautista was average, while his character felt incredibly random, and for Stallone, I feel this movie, and franchise, is a "why not" type of involvement for him, or maybe even a favor. His performance was okay with a splash of lazy, which I doubt he was too bothered about, while Huang Xiaoming seemed to have given it his all, but sadly his all wasn't great at all. The story is a repeat for the most part that even felt thin on this occasion, the CGI came straight out of PlayStation 2, and the directing was simply, bad, with dreadful action sequences.This movie is an unsurprising 3.4/10.

This movie from the beginning had no chance of succeeding. Who are these people! Why should I care. If they did a better job of explaining who these people are maybe it would have saved the first act. The first 20 minutes Sly is like this prison breaking sensei in this movie. There is no hard coded subtitles and all their names feel like "fighdhfg" and "dhigfhdfgb". I couldn't care less who is in it from the poster if it's a good story it's a good story regardless if it's actually Sly escaping these over the top prisons or not. The director just wanted the movie to look pretty for the visuals and everyone looked in dire need of a shower. Granted you're not going to look like a movie star in jail but I don't know.If he was going to out source everyone to be in a team why not spend the first little while training a team or something so it's easier to process who is who and actually focus on the story. The first 5 or so minutes I wasn't sure if I was watching the right movie. You know the movie was going to bomb though when there was half a dozen production teams.I think I spent more time writing this review than watching the movie. 0 out of 10. The only thing you'll want to escape is the movie theater. Why even call it escape plan if Sly just makes such brief cameos.
Don't be fooled by the half decent cast. This is a genuinely terrible movie.

Any action movie fan is probably familiar with this film's hilariously bad reputation. People just hate it. With a passion. And it's hilarious.Yes, ok, yes. It's bad. Cheap-looking, cheaply executed entertainment with meh acting and an overwrought story that can't just pick a lane genre-wise. It's an action thriller, with a bit of a sci-fi element that doesn't really work (the prison is futuristic and high tech), making it look like a Doctor Who (2005) episode.It may be the worst of Sylvester Stallone's career, which is sad because he still has charisma and physicality. I love Dave Bautista, and was excited to see him and Stallone doing their thing together, even if Arnold's absence is still damaging to the movie's appeal. Sadly, Bautista is barely in it. He is in like, three or four scenes total, and he only has two action scenes, in which all he really does is shoot some dudes. Sylvester Stallone strangely isn't in it as much as he should be, though I guess he's there a fair amount. But when he gets top-billing, he should appear way more than a fair amount. It's horribly underwhelming.The action sequences are the movie's saving grace, and that's not saying much. There are some well-choreographed fight scenes, a cool bar shootout where Stallone and Bautista kill bad guys, and some good sequences at the end. Sly does have a brutal final fight, which is cool. The violence is pretty graphic, but not OTT.Xiaoming Huan is a great martial artist tho. He takes center stage for much of the movie with lots of cool kung fu-oriented fight scenes. My problem isn't that he's so central, it's that he's central at the expense of Stallone and Bautista. It's like when you're at a concert for a band you love, and you really like the opener band, but then you realize they have the majority of the concert's length. No matter how good they are, they're not who you're there for.It's just kind of a mess. The script is muddled, the action is well-done but kind of underwhelming, the two great leads are barely present, and the villains are completely forgettable. It might be really hard to like for a lot of people, and this is as forgiving a review as I can give. It's definitely not the worst movie I've ever seen, like it seems to be with so many other people. It's still better than the DTV garbage Steven Seagal is still putting out.

reviews.review_title: "Hey get that camera out of my face!"

It was never used.2) Where did all the prisoners go in the end? Did they evaporate?Truly awful. Don't waste your time.

Miss this movie. The cover is deceiving, considering Stallone is only in the movie for about 15 minutes. The acting is sub-par, the CGI looks as though it was made on an iPhone third-party app, and the story is ridiculously bad. There are so many lens flares that if you are prone to seizures I would straight up skip this movie. I'm talking lens flares outside, lens flares inside, lens flares from desk lamps, there are lens flares INSIDE of vans. JJ Abrams called and said, "Whoa, that's too much."

The storyline and the general idea was really good - in particular, the beginning portion of the movie set the scene well.
I also like how they made it different to the first movie (so it wasn't just another generic storyline of Sylvester trying to break out of somewhere).However the movie wasn't exciting. I think the main issue was based on the prison scenes:The prison was too stripped back... I understand what they were trying to do by making a prison with no loopholes. However - one of the things that I find exciting about watching a prison break, is trying to think of loopholes and methods of escaping along with the character. But I think the prison was too stripped back - to the point that it kinda made it boring.The prison scenes were dull. It mainly consisted of a series of fight scenes back to back, which had minimal contribution to the storyline. (I think Stallone should have gone into the prison a lot earlier. As things were really revived when he came in, and the pace picked up).I left with an overall feeling that the prisoners never outsmarted the system, or found a way to escape from the inside out. It was more that the outside were the main force in helping them to get out.At the end, we never got to see them have freedom... it just ended with them still inside the prison. So it didn't really feel concluded.Overall... I really like the concept of the movie; but I struggle to give it a high rating for those reasons.

reviews.review_title: This movie made me feel cheated.
reviews.content:
I've been a big fan of Sylvester Stallone's movies for as long as i can remember and i enjoyed the first Escape Plan movie quite a bit. It stars Stallone and Arnold Schwarzenegger, two of the most legendary action movie stars of all time. It isn't a classic like First Blood or Predator but it's an enjoyable action/prison escape movie with decent action scenes and some genuine laugh out loud moments which felt like they were tailored for fans of the genre.Escape plan 2 is garbage. On the movie poster Stallone and Dave Batista (Hell yeah, let's go!) are front and centre so i went in to this expecting it to be a fun time.
The actual star of the movie is some Chinese dude who i've never heard of (he is nowhere to be seen on the poster advertising the movie) and is also a bad actor with zero charismaStallone is more like a side character in his own movie and Batista is in it for about 10 minutes, he doesn't really do anything and the bad guys are all played by people who look and act like they're from a cheesy soap opera.
The action scenes are shot in that annoying quick-cut headache inducing shakey style which i really hate and overall it's just dull.The worst part is once the credits rolled i felt cheated. It's crap. Don't bother.
A BIG disapointment. Really loved the first one,but this is Just bad. The only thing lifting it up from one are the actors.

reviews.review_title: OK so I fell victim too
reviews.content:
You see i kinda liked the first movie. Sure it was disappointing to see two action heroes of the 80s so old but at least it had a realistic premise as well as Jim Caviezel, a very good actor. The escape was also interesting.
For this "sequel" forget all that! It has no redeeming qualities whatsoever.
The scenes were all over the place, it was jumping from one to another without any cohesion. The transitions were so bad for a moment i thought my hard drive was dying! I'm not kidding!
The plot was silly beyond belief too. I won't mention any spoilers because there aren't any!
Oh and that CGI... it hurt my eyes every single time. They tried to make it futuristic by having large monitors.... The problem is what those monitors were showing! One had a huuuuuuge text scrolling indefinitely at speeds only Lieutenant Data could read. Most had meaningless rotating geometric patterns! And of course the omg-kill-me-now cliche of the operator typing fast on a keyboard while looking at those rotating patterns!!
On a second thought, i will include a spoiler....
Remember in the first movie how awesomely they found their location by looking at the star positions?
Well in this god-forsaken "sequel" Sly has a transmitter in his ... teeth!.
Oh and it gets better...
Sly's partners remotely hacked the prison via that link in his teeth!
They were able to remotely disable the cameras but still had no idea where the prison was!
And there's plenty more ridiculous stuff going on. The operator of the prison communicates with the mastermind behind it all via a huge monitor. A sort of life-size holographic representation of the mastermind occupies the screen. Over the top? Surely but they apparently spared no expenses so why not?... Problem is they decided to distort the voice of the mastermind, you know, that deep voice you hear in witness-protection programs. What was the point of that voice distortion effect when his image was perfectly clear without any distortions?!!
Oh boy I think I've already paid more attention to these stuff than the writers themselves.
Watch it only if you want to see how low Sly's career has fallen. Don't expect a serious movie like the first part.

I have no idea what I just watched. Actually to be honest I only got through just over 60mins, and that was through shear force of will. I don't even know how to review this one and I'm not going to waste too much of my time and yours doing it. Bottom line is that the story is incompressible, I couldn't care less about any of the characters, the prison itself bears no resemblance to anything even remotely realistic or plausible and seems to have some insanely stupid future technology built into it using physics from a parallel dimension.
So if you are of thinking watching this because you enjoyed the first one, save your money go look elsewhere.

This felt very rushed when it was developed just for the sake of making a sequel and i was very dissapointed. The fight scenes at the beginning where actually semi-decent but that's the most i would say was good. the CGI "Shocks" and "neon lights" was god-awful.
