reviews.review_title: This movie is so bad that we should be naming and shaming the individuals responsible
reviews.content: Honesty I am shocked above all. The first escape plan was such a good movie. Everything about it was interesting, new and unique and enjoyable to watch with a great cast! There is nothing to suggest that a sequel could have done this badly.I don't think it is merely a coincidence that this movie did as badly as it did. There were some very, VERY poor decisions made throughout the movie which resulted in this complete and utter train wreck and embarrassment of a sequel to be produced. I honestly think movies that do this badly are on another level of bad, and the people responsible should be named and shamed and sacked immediately as they are clearly not suited to the movie industry. Sure, everyone makes mistakes, but such an accumulation and frequency of them in such a high magnitude points to a very unsuitable individual in the movie industry. So I had another look into the details to help me understand how this all could have gone wrong.First, let's look at the cast. Yes, some of the acting was dry and bad, but there were 3 amazing actors part of the cast which should have boosted the appeal by a great deal. So why didn't it? Well, it could be because the main and loved actors were barely featured in the movie. Now this could be down to poor writing of the movie but when we look at Miles Chapman's previous works including escape plan 1, they were largely great hits and there were few major problems in his writing that could lead to this being produced. Even with gaps in the movie plots and a poorly thought out scene can easily be amended if the director and other writers have any half of a brain to do so to still transform the movie into something great. We see this all the time and movies are never the same as books, but rather key scenes put together to tell us roughly the same story in a logical and well thought out way.I began focusing my attention on the director of this movie. Some unknown guy called Steven C. Miller. Have you ever heard of him? Nope, neither have I. At first glance, this guy is a 5 foot 5, beerbellied, overtattood man with a terrible track record in the past. After observing his previous works, just one of his movies has scored over a rating of 5/10, and even that was a close call as well. So what were people expecting hiring this man? That suddenly he would produce a masterpiece as good as the first movie when he barely has produced a watchable movie in the past on not even half the budget this movie had? I honestly think this is where the movie goes wrong. Whoever was responsible for hiring this complete clown essentially ruined the franchise from day 1, and seeing the result, I can't be surprised that Steven C Miller cannot cope with such a big movie as this, considering his past works are a complete joke and taunt to good movie directors. The poor efforts and abilities of this man have resulted in a terrible unwatchable tragedy of a movie, and this man should never be allowed to work on a film again as he has proven time and time again of how incapable and how unsuitable he is for directing.In conclusion, I think this movie failed for a large number of factors, but the largest of all, the one which put this movie in the top 100 worst ever movies of all time, was the incapable and unintelligent director (should not even have the privilege of being called one), Steven C Miller, who's terrible sense of directing and track record resulted in one of the most catastrophic failures from a good franchise I have ever witnessed in my life. This man should be sacked and fined for his terrible work, and I think this movie should be remade with the same director from the first movie before you guys go ahead and make the third because this is unacceptable garbage that fans cannot possible ever want, no matter how hard they try to bare it.

reviews.review_title: Poor script = poor film = sad, because the idea is great

I did get one chuckle out of Dave Bautista because Dave Bautista.

I made it 20-25 minutes in. Despite reading about how bad it was beforehand, I felt I had to give it a chance. This is nothing like the first one. The CGI makes bad CGI look like Avatar (as in, the CGI here is worse than bad). I'll be skipping the third one. Don't waste your time OR money, folks.

reviews.review_title: Stallone, how could you do this to your fans
reviews.content: I'm about 70 minutes in right now. It's ok to do cameos. It's ok to milk a good thing. It's ok to disappoint once in a while. But whatever this movie was, is not acceptable. Syfy channel level quality of VFX, some actors are horribly miscast. Reminds me of that other Made in China fiasco called China Salesman.
What a load of rubbish. The first Escape Plan was an enjoyable film, this one is very poor and I dread to think what the 3rd instalment is going to be like. Don't waste your time on this.

This movie really terible, the story line is not understand-able, the acting and the effect are so bad! 
Too many naration in that movie, I feel like Sylvester Stallon was a just motivator rather than main character. I can score it zero if I can!

This is one of the worst movies I have ever seen, I never thought Sly could scoop this low, but he did. I liked the first one and was surprised to know there was a sequel, but unfortunately there's a reason for the "silent" release. I couldn't wait for this movie to end right from the beginning. If I could give this title 0/10 I would have. This is garbage. If you are gonna watch this, don't expect anything bit cheap acting, cheap CGI, cheap script honestly cheap everything.
The movie is UNWATCHABLE, The story is BAD and UNREALISTIC, and the worst thing is the cast, please don't waste your time on this NONSENSE.

Well, in my old years Sylvester Stallone was my second favorite actor (I'm sorry, but this is true). First, of course, was Schwarzenegger. Yes, good old days (hmmmm... I'm only 29! What is old days!?)From Stallone you expect always one thing - action, action and action! And a little drama (remember Rocky?). Yes, he can this. But in my heart he always a fearless hero. Besides, I liked another his characters in comedy. But, Escape Plan. The first movie was good. Not excellent, but you have this "warm" feelings after film. For me, there are three basis of success: good actors, good story and good atmosphere. And Escape Plan partly has everything. Good actors - well, there are "stars of 90th" Stallone and Schwarzenegger. Good story - well, neither new, nor very interesting, but with some charm. Good atmosphere - yes for me.And from second part I expected two things - Stallone and good atmosphere. And... got nothing. The story is very similar to old Plan with some modification. In the centre of plot two Asian brothers, one of which work for Stallone's company. But there no interest for looking at all acting. The actors are washy and their characters are similar. Two pillars of movie - Stallone himself and Bautista, hadn't time and willing to show themself in full force. Sly has a little time maybe of his age. Well, but I turn on this movie because of him! And Bautista... Well, Bautista is Bautista. He is weak as actor and you can use him as one-time characters, such as: "This is Bautista! Wow!". And then forgot about him. His best role is in the Guardians of the Galaxy as Drax the Destroyer. This is mean something, if you understand me. The overall atmosphere is weird. Creators thought about future prison as collection of dark with color lights, robots and holograms. But this is more hiding bad fantasy, then showing "future". The movie is so "peaceful", that showing only minimum of the minimums of blood. You know, this "piu-piu" sound and etc. But in the last scene we can look at the beaten face of Sly. Main villain - are your joking?! He is so cute and useless, that you can't perceive him seriously. Sorry, pal. Even plot twist (if we can call it such word) can't help. I expected for trap, but not so big! Sorry Sly, but we can't eat this. Only 2 Sly from 10.

Basic action movie I found entertaining. A problem with a 'secret patent' by some viewers, believing there's no such thing. Patents may be kept secret if tenets meet the Invention Secrecy Act; such as, the patent is a threat to USA national security.
I enjoyed the vivid imagination of the persons responsible for the movie. Thanks.

If I hadn't read reviews before hand then this film would have been exactly as I expected it to be. Sure Stallone wasn't in it as much as I expected but "Shu's" fight choreography was great and the rest of the plot was more or less what the synopsis says. It's not a classic but I never expected it to be, neither was the first (and TBH I preferred this one to the first) but I can't fathom giving it a 1/10 like some here and can only guess that some have an issue with an Asian lead character.

A waste of time. Sylvester Stallone, made a bad choice associating his name with this piece of garbage. This is one of those films, here today, gone tomorrow. Don't spend your money on this piece of garbage.
What you'd expect from the king of sequels. If you're looking for something meaningful or thought provoking then you've chosen the wrong movie.
Its not bad at all. Didn't have super high expectations so I enjoyed it.

I've never had so much fun at a movie in years...!!! Easily Silvester Stallone's best film since Rambo 10 years ago, it was about time. Very inventive film technically, at some scenes I was crying and smiling at the same time just from the rush of intense feelings of euphoria and sheer joy of what I was seeing.

reviews.review_title: If this isn't Stallone worst movie, that's because he is barely in it.
reviews.content: Was Escape Plan really in need of a sequel? Probably not. But here we are, not only with a sequel, but with third part already in the can (can't understand anyone being exited for it after this huge mess). I liked the fist movie, but when it was announced that Arnold was not coming back for this one I knew something wasn´t right. Then they announced Steven C. Miller was directing and my worst fears became true. Escape Plan 2 is nothing more (and surprisingly a lot less) than another of those cash grab direct-to-dvd sequels that has little of what made the original great (or in this case, at least an entertaining action/adventure throwback with two of the greatest movie stars of the 80s and 90s). It's boring, poorly acted and even laughable at parts, but certainly not enough to enjoy it as a guilty pleasure. I would say this is the worst movie Stallone has ever done, but Sly is barely in it. And even when he is on the screen, he isn´t. It looks like he didn't care, and I can't blame him, even the one-liners he deliver are bad. This lazy ass movie doesn't deserve your time, money or attention.

I saw the cast was old man Stallone and aging Bautista and the movie was exactly as expected. Somewhat lazy script, evading plotline, cheese one-liners and a lot of punches to the face. Would definitely not watch it again, but I got exactly what I came for.

I can't believe that Stallone has done this movie, Cinematography is extremely poor, Main asian characters can't speak English properly, Visual Effects poor, Dialogues poor. everything about this movie is below average.

I knew the movie wasn't going to be great, but you can always spot a terrible director when there's any kind of action and their only idea is to shake the camera like there's an earthquake. Well, this director's takes the cake (and shakes it), hopefully he never does another movie agin.

They had everything great actors, good set and production values. But what happened?
The story telling was really bad, leaving you lost and wondering did you miss something important. I blame the confusing cinematography and editing style.May be some of the charter casting was not believable for a hardcore prison, and some fight scenes where a but tame in places. 
Could have been great ;-(

Unbelievably bad acting and writing!! Payday for Stallone I'd say. Why was bautista in this??? He done nothing! Most secure prison ever, bautista breaks in through the front door in a hummer!
Utter rubbish that made no sense!
But must say we had fun laughing at how awful this was and will most likely do the same with the sequel! YES, THERES A SEQUEL!
Quite possibly the worst film I have seen in a very long time.

This is the worst sequel i ever watched. The first Escape Plan is rather good i think, but this one seems to have a 100 dollar budget. The effects are so bad i could have make them in Paint. The acting is so poor that it should be better if they picked people from the street. Stallone cant think this is good? The plot seems to be written at a lunch break by a 10 year old kid. So dont waste your time!
Solid actors but the worst CGI ever - I mean it's "Sharktopus"-bad...

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies I have ever seen
reviews.content: I don't understand how someone can make a movie this bad.. do they even watch it? What is with the terrible cinematography and lighting...Do not recommend. Really wish I did not even attempt to watch. like honestly.. wtf were they thinking.
Sucks because no subtitles no clue what they are saying

reviews.review_title: Bad sequel for a not that great 1st movie
reviews.content: The overall 3,8 rating seems fair enough.The 1st movie had two acting "heavy weights", and the plot/script and acting wasn't all that bad. A decent movie, for some entertainment. This for who likes the genre.This sequel has one "heavy weight", and some "light weights"! Couldn't resist the joke calling Batista a "light weight". But all in all, crap plot/script, not developed and built in time enough, and the acting was...crappy... The expendables, any one of them, is better than this.

We want to talk about how they stun prisoners ?
What are these lightning ?
20 years ago they did better
The original was good then they tried to update the style and it just went south, sylvester stalone isn't even the main character, lame, skip this one

Never write a review before but now i do because i get despondent.
This is not worth to be called B-Movie not even worth C
Really waste of time.
What the F do 50cent and Stallone do in this movie?
The new chackie chan are so B. He look so fake and reminds me of "true or dare" is also a another B-Movie that wasted my time.

Pertaining to the very first escape plan movie it was phenomenal. This movie was so bad subject-wise, nonetheless Sylvester Stallone you only seen for about 15 minutes in the movie. This movie was so noxious in a bad way, I'm assuming that's why they made the third one? One year later. "The first escape plan" was a Paramount film with well molded acting, featuring Arnold Schwarzenegger, and a movie that actually showed equivalency pertaining to great acting and a shadow two legends acting humorous and very solidified the entire film. The second one was to matrix fantasy type for me to actually dig into I actually skip that least 10 minutes of the movie due to lack of interest. I'm hoping the third one I'm watching right now is a lot better than Hades. All assumptions aside, I'm only 5 minutes into the movie and I could already tell "escape plan 3" (extractors) should already contain the same footwork pertaining to the very first movie in 2013.

I should've suspected something when at the outset I noted that there were about six different production companies behind this film, none of which I'd ever heard of. Apparently, raising capital to make this mess required reaching out to the newbie stupid money. (The first rule of private investing: Ask yourself, "If this is such a great opportunity, why is it being offered to ME?"). I wouldn't call this flick "bad" because that would be unfair to all the really bad movies out there.

Badly filmed
Bad script 
Bad everythingSuch a shame some money spent on a new camera man, better script and background story could have been an ok action movie. If you are expecting similar to Escape Plan the original you will feel very let down. Not worth the watch. Jx

It's sure not the best movie but it's not the worst. Some parts of the script seem a bit off and I felt that I have seen these exact scenes in other movies... For me it has very good cinematography and the choice of anamorphic lenses in some scenes made it easier to watch...
Was really disappointed in this movie.. liked the first one but every "plot twist" they had in this was really bad and way too easy to guess from the start... 1star only

This film should be filed in the annals of film history as how not to make a film let alone a sequel. The acting was robotic at best with the dialogue sounding as if it was written by a 6 year old who's first language is not English. The camera work is quite shocking as if the 6 year old's friend filmed the whole thing on her dad's 1985 camcorder whilst bouncing on a space hopper. The camcorder was also used to create the CGI which has to be the worst I have seen for a long time. Leave this one alone and save yourself the anguish of losing over an hour and a half of your time that you wil not get back.
The first one was quite good, but this is so so bad that I don't know where to start. Really bad script, dialog etc. Stallones worst movie ever

...because lines like " Why they just simply kill someone to get rid of him?" "Because the world would know he is dead, locking him up here makes him just disapear" ....yea right...enough reason to build a supa techno dupa high-tech prison where a tooth-walky-talky has no problem establishing connection. Man this movie, besides that silly 24/7 security and obersvation where people still can secretly make plans, build gadgets and what you have, has the worst shaky action cameraman i ve ever seen and the music reminds me of the 80´s first synthesizers...dont look for any CGI, this movie was made in a lost chamber....

I cant believe how low great actors can go. They must be out of money to do this sequel. Don't waste your time, 3.8 (current rating) is way too high. The camera work makes you sea sick. Zooming in on faces constantly show pimples not character. The action is cheap shake the camera and also quick flashes (of scenes) to hide the poor delivery, sloppy action and zero choreography. What a contrived story hardly ties in to the 1st movie.I really hate to see these fine actors wasting their talent and my time to put out such trash. Gave a 2 only because of the actors, story is a 1, camera work is a 1.

reviews.review_title: They've dirtyed the name of Sylvester Stallone.
reviews.content: The worst movie I've ever seen. The shooting angles are very bad, close to the face so that no sloppy background is visible. The script is irrational. The trailer of the movie is very misleading.

reviews.review_title: I can't they rolled this one out
reviews.content: Horrible, the special effects were cheesy, the plot had been done before & over all just a bad film. The reason I didn't give it a one-star is because I like Sylvester Stallone, maybe should have had no sequel to Escape Plan, I loved the first one.
Worst film ever made. Totally different from the first 1. Don't waste ur time
This movie was just bad, a million pieces that just do not fit. Major let down.

Was realy dissapointed with this one. I liked the first one - it wasn't no mindblowing cinematic achievement, but it was fun to see Arnie and Sly team up and they actually looked like they were enjoying making that movie, which turned out as a solid piece of action. This one, however, seemed more like a 'leftover' side scripted first one. Acting wasn't that great, but what can you do, even Brando couldn't pull this one off with those scripted lines. I had trouble getting through the movie itself, since it's pace was so non-linear (even though, that can be good sometimes, trust me, this time it wasn't). Sly was barely in this movie, pushed more to the side role in the first half. Even Bautista appearing here and there, with that actor from Desperate housewives didn't help this movie. Script was just so vague. Sly looked like he just had to do this one, for no real reason at all - there's a third part coming soon aswell. I give it a merciful 5, since the soundtrack (retro 80s nuances) and some fight scenes from the begining were alright, 50 and DH dude weren't bad either, but everything else is just bad. Looks more like a TV movie, even though the cinematography and editing were done nicely.

reviews.review_title: OMG! is this the new "Plan 9" for millennials?
reviews.content: This is a bizarre movie with bad script, bad and magic tech, anthropomorphic AIs (why o whyyyy!!!) bad cuts, a poorly constructed & completely unnecessary "Fast and Furious" scene and terse and campy dialogue.Will recommend!

Ok B movie story wise but the camera work was just awful. Unnecessarily dark and if I got motion sickness I'd be barfing all over the place. When the camera is cutting 2-3 times a second over and over and jumping like mad it makes for a horrible viewing experience. I think it was worse than Bornue 5.Just imagine if this was in imax 3D. It would cost more to clean the place afterwards than they would make in ticket sales.If you liked the first one its not horrible but please bring a barf bag.

reviews.review_title: Awful sequel to a good movie
reviews.content: I enjoyed the first one a lot. I actually watched it twice. It was tense with interesting puzzles and action scenes. I just can't understand how they were able to mess this one so bad. The acting is awful for the most part, there is no flow to the scenes, they're entirely disconnected, and the story is terrible. I gave it 3 stars because in that terrible story there is a plot twist which actually caught me by surprise and one action scene that was half-decent. Beyond that not worth it.
Really enjoyed the first movie, if I could unwatch this one I would.

I first see Stallone face one the flyer I had been waiting to see this movie. When I saw it, I feel sorry for him has to involve in this low grade movie. Splash of ITs and Zooming on Xiaoming Face again and again, like he is the only very handsome one in the world. The plot and the story line have alot of holes and bad! Just give me back my time and money!!!

reviews.review_title: I should have believed the other comments,
reviews.content:
This movie was soo bad i am writing my first review.
Why, why would you make something like this. Poor acting, poor script, bad action all and all no story at all to follow, even my cat got bored during the fightscene and went for a nap.
Sly has totally lost his charm, he needs to sit at his retire home and play bingo! Avoid this movie

Well I'm a huge fan of the first one. I will admit its a different direction from what you're used to seeing. Althought overall I liked it. Yeah it has its quirks and nothing like the first one,but if you give it a shot I think you could like it. Not saying its better then the first one. The ending does have a cliff hanger which is upsetting. Its honestly one if those movies you watch one time and that's it. Overall its a decent movie. Can't really hate on it to much. Its a little too much futuristic with robots. It does jump around a lot on the story but overall its a good movie.

Wow. Just...wow. I'm not sure where to even start. The dreadful acting, nonsensical confusing script, or the 90s TV-grade special effects. Or perhaps the two or three indistinguishable bearded characters in the film (one of them is the main villain apparently, but thanks to the poor editing and wardrobe I couldn't quite figure out which one I was looking at).What an awful fuster-cluck of a film. I feel sorry for the film's investors. They got ripped off. More money was spent on the end credits than the rest of the film combined.
Slow and agonizing story development.Too many questions left unanswered until the end. I hope they are not considering another sequel.
The cam shacking from beginning until the end...story line damn lame...and what Bautista use for? Just showing awhile but appear on the poster...feeling been cheated...

It's painful to watch this movie, i was on my phone waiting for it to end.
that's it.

The script is like a kinder garden kid wrote it. Along that there is a bad acting and bad filming. Basically the whole concept is stupid, things just happens. There is no story, no connection. Nothing makes sense. Stallone and Bautista were more as secondary actors, their role was mostly minor, some stuff at the end. If you liked first movie forget about this, it will ruin it for you. It did for me.
This is a disaster. Not even a "prety female no brain" characeter. Dont waste your time - students with phones shoot better movies than this!

Expecting much more than this, since the first movie served us a very good story. Shu's acting was terrible, so was Yusheng's. I mean, hello dude, you should learn more, you were on frame with Stallone, in Hollywood ! An the story was terrible.Prison on the vessel above the sea is more acceptable than below a church ! Come on !
A very bad movie than will ruin your night. Script is bad and the graphics is bad

Escape Plan 1 was so good so i have very high expectations on this second one. But i am very disappointed. The camera in this movie is shaking all the time like someone record it with bare hands. Plus if you'll wondering in this movie Sylvester Stallone was not main character but some Chinese guy who quite annoyed me.
The first part was a pretty decent movie, but the second one sucks badly. Escape plan II gives trash a new meaning.

reviews.review_title: A disappointing sequel to a promising story-line
reviews.content:
I have to admit I really enjoyed the first film, it was thrilling at moments and the storyline had a unique twist on the typical prison escape films - of which I am very fond of. 
Hoowever from simply observing the trailer it is clear they have decided to 'hollywood-e-fy' the film and introduce masses of explosions, guns and over the top special fx which I am certain will take away the main joys oof watching a prison escape.
the plan-the prison
the intricacy and suspense. Introducing this immense violence and war mode is just ridiculous and am sure on its release will result in the films flop.
Its a shame.
Predictable and seen 1000 times. Full of cliches. This is sad, stalone. Very very sad....

Let me put it this way, Stallone is now making Steven Seagal movies.
CGI is amateurish at best, on top of all the other problems. Script hilariously bad.Just don't.

I don't know what all the 'negative fuss' is about. This is hands down the funniest comedy ever produced! An academy award would not do it justice. The laughs are virtually non stop. From the opening titles to the end credits tears of laughter would soak three rolls of toilet paper. Now I have nothing to wipe my ___ with.For cryin' out loud, folks ( pun inteded ), give it up for "Escape Plan 2"! The funniest comedy of all time! Worth every penny of my hard earned fifteen bucks. And more!What? Say that again. It's not a comedy? You gotta be kidding. You're not kidding. It's not supposed to be funny? Well I'll be damned. Fooled me.Never mind then. ;-)))

Just wow, this is insane. I rented this movie based on how good the first one actually was. But wow i went wrong. This i a terrible movie. Impossible to follow. Hard to look at due to the way they are filming and the effects in the movie. In the end of the movie i did not even know any of the characters names? This is so bad, i wasted My money and i hope you do not waste yours.
This movie is unbelievable bad the special effect look like was doing with a Commodore 64

I loved the first one, it was fun and exciting, but this one is just shallow and stupid. I hated the shaky close camera every moment and the fight scenes were also very dumb and just an overcut mess. Acting is sub par and the story is very weak. Wanted to leave after 30 mins, but gave it a chance since I really liked the first one, now I truly regret my decision.

If you are a fan of the first one then don't watch this one. I like the first one so I was looking forward to getting this one. It is missing Arnold and Sly is a secondary character. It is also boring and doesn't make much of an effort to gain your attention. I'm not surprised that it is a financial failure with so many bad reviews here and I can't believe that they are pushing forward with a third. Hopefully with that one they will learn from their mistakes but I'm not counting on it.

Shocked with the low ratings. The movie is unpredictable! I love that Stallone have less fights and more of a mentor, suits his image. If it's not him being the lead here, might not be that good enough.Prison tech maybe not mind blowing but the plot is different. 
With Patience and brains nothing is impossible!

reviews.content: TERRIBLE movie. It's hard to believe it's even related to the first one. Don't waste your time.
Don't know what's worse, the plot or the acting. Amazing how good actors can make such a bad movie.
........ Yep. Worst movie I've ever watched. That is all.

Please avoid watching this one it's just a waste of time... stupid way of presentation of a movie which had a good reputation part 1.
Usually i do check some reviews of movies before putting it on watch list. But this one i went on blind due to Stallone...
Except for the starting thrilling action the movie felt like a drama made for school project.
Waste of time and money....

reviews.review_title: not so bad as people say!!!!
reviews.content: Never have i put any word on any site as a reviewer. but seeing how many bad reviews this movie gets, is very weird to me. i found the movie very entertaining, very. sure, it's no blockbuster, but it deffinetly is NOT a B-movie. the story is nothing really new or special, but the plot twitst (although from the start of the movie you know how it will end, they escape) are plenty there, and some you dont see coming. it's the breaking down from the people, and those twists, that made the movie well worth watching. sly has'nt got the lead-role, and maybe that makes the movie that much better. if sly would be the mean caracter, it would have given the movie a much bigger load and many more expactations. so forget he play's in this movie, and just enjoy. i did.

= Rubbish Movie

reviews.review_title: If you liked the original Escape Plan...
reviews.content:
Yes, I knew about all the bad reviews. But I really liked Escape Plan and loved the idea of a sequel. And the trailer didnt seem too terrible. So I just had to give it a shot.But OMG, everyone was right. This is a total piece of trash. It really isnt Escape Plan 2, they simple added that for name recognition. Its just awful. So if you liked the first one, DONT see this one, it adds nothing.1. It's boring. There is no reason to care about the plot or the characters.
2. Its terribly shot. There are no interesting sets, no effects, no cool locations. Nothing. The "prison" is just a big room with dark edges so you cant really see whats going on. 
3. Stallone is not a main character here and Bautista is in the film even less. Its actually quite misleading to even put their images on the cover. The majority of the movie focuses on a couple people we have no reason to care about.

I have never bailed on a movie 20 minutes before ending and i assure you i've seen a lot of trash movies , only a 10 year old would enjoy this movie where the bad guy makes no sense at all ! The escape plan has so many plot holes to mention here that it seems that the guy who wrote the script was either drunk or didnt care if it would make any sense at all.RUBBISH!!!!!!!

Part 1 was fantasic.. part 2 is the opposit.
Silvester is a Legend. Stop acting like Rocky, you will nail comedy, family or mastermids movies

I got nothing more than that. It's just bad. Actors should remove it from their resume. I recognize Sylvester Stallone, Jesse Metcalf, David Bautista. These guys should know better. Did they read the script? Probably not. Just another sequel that tanks.

reviews.review_title: B O R I N G
reviews.content: Very disappointing...unless you're fascinated with Kung Fu and fighting...bring Arnold back!!
One of the few films i just had to turn off. Didnt even get to david batuista

reviews.review_title: Don't listen to those other guys!
reviews.content: Watch this movie for the entertainment value. Stallone being Stallone in a movie. Batista and Stallone make a great team. Don't listen to the haters. Movies like this need to be taken at face value not based on previous actor movies. I loved this movie!! You should too! I dare you to watch this and leave a negative review!

To China, you've disappointed me. To the lead actor, just because you're semi good-looking does not mean you don't need to act, this is still a movie with some big name actors (even though they just appear for 10 minutes). Just don't bother.
Very mediocre
Cheap and nasty cgi

reviews.review_title: To be avoided at all costs!
reviews.content:
I actually liked the first movie, so I'm very disappointed in this sequel.
The camerawork is terrible, plot jumps all over the place, acting is mediocre, storyline non existent, music badly placed and too bombastic and
the CGI is worse than the Scorpion King....

Just a way of time and not even worth to be played as a background movie on a party.
Very very bad movie. dont see this one. the main charater was too bad atctor. very disapointed wwith Stalone
Sucks. 1 point cause of Rocky. Glad Arnold quit this series
Please... avoid this film^, it's horrible with so many clichês!Lazy scrip and I don't know how Stallone agree to make this film!
The story was better than I expected, a lot of action and nice effects. After seeing this I was not at all dissapointed.

I loved the first movie it was very creative and the less futuristic than this movie. Also this has nothing to do with escape plan 1.
i Mean when you look at the ending of escape plan 1 arnold schwarznegger says
" if you need any help" *points thumb to his chest* * arnold gets driven away and the movie ends*. in this context you would think he would be in the second movie or atleast something similar but all of the sudden a part 2 movie introduces me to asians ive never seen before. it was so weird you know what i mean??
A film taken on an iPhone 5 camera. Not even 6. Maybe they knew that this film will not succeed(((
No wonder I was hiding under my blanket to get away from this horrible movie with a horrible plot and all in all very horrible movie. Totally agree with the other reviews... not worth the time

So terrible I kinda enjoyed it. Stupid script, lousy sets, bad acting and horrible directing, what more can you ask for besides your money back? :D
It is a wonder they actually made this crap.

The most terrible movie I ever watched.....!!!!!
do not waste your time for that!!
I really honestly hope the next movie can go back to being like the first one. This movie is so bad it is a huge waste of time.

reviews.review_title: Very little planning went into this
reviews.content: The original was a good watch. 80s action stars, clever 'heist' like set-up, what's not to love? Unfortunately this was poorly thought out. The escape wasn't really that clever in the end, and relied heavily on 'man messing around on a keyboard and magic happening'. Stallone is a secondary actor, if he was central then maybe he could have carried the clunky action and awkward dialogue. As it stands, the A-List B-Team did a half-assed job in both respects. It's still watchable, perhaps while you're doing something else, wallpaper, essentially.

reviews.review_title: what was This? disappointment that's what!
reviews.content:
So apparently the remake was focused on entertaining the international audience which was evident by the casting and awful cinematography. I really enjoyed the original. Which I had just came across not to long ago. Skimming through movie titles late one night I found it and thought "oh, this will be some good background noise to fall asleep to." WRONG. I was up until 3 a.m completely engrossed in the film. Loved it! I was then excited to see a part 2 pop up in my movie feed recently. More Stallone and Schwarzenegger action? Yes please! But nope. Not here. Maybe now that you have your audience intrigued with your follow up movies reunite the Holy grail action mashup of action heros to ever set foot on my television screen for the 3rd movie. Because that was one fantastic movie. Maybe spend more than 20 days on set? While impressive to shoot a full feature in that amount of time it would be more impressive if the feature was actually good. . Which this was not. If you came here for reviews before watching this film...don't. You will be disappointed. 
Go back and watch the first one instead. I'll be latching for 3 to reunite original cast.
Always loved and will love Stallone movies, but this is one of his worst! You never even get the feeling, that this is a Stallone movie. Bad plot, bad cutting, bad acting, bad everything.

reviews.review_title: Waited to get out so badly
reviews.content: Nothing is good on this one...please please don't waist your time watching this one.

The first movie wasn't good, but it had the vibe of the sunday action flick you enjoy without putting too much thought into it.The sequel could've been a good continuation, had the writers decided to stick to a couple of focal points, instead of continuously adding plot devices that are never explored or explained again.
The scenes and settings change so quickly and are so disjointed throughout the movie, that in the end the spectator is left with a bored anticipation only a 1h30 long trailer could accomplish. Dialogue is so badly written that one could watch the movie without any of it, and come out with the exact same understanding of the plot.Unlike in the first movie, where the catharsis is brought by the characters discovering what and where the prison is, the ending here is so lackluster and blatantly set up to be continued in a third, possibly even worse sequel, that it makes this one of the worst movies I have ever watched. And the worst thing about it? It's not one of those "movies so bad they make you laugh". It's just cringe inducingly bad.2/10 because set design wasn't bad, and CGI, while low-budget, is sparingly used and isn't as bad as some other reviewers make it out to be.

reviews.review_title: So bad i turned it off!

The CGI in this movie looks like it was drawn by a nine year old. The story is muddled, incomprehensible and stupid. The characters are so badly introduced, it's impossible to care about them. The concept of a futuristic prison is so ridiculous, it's laughable. The soundtrack is horribly derivative. The camera work is so shaky, your eyes will roll out of your head. The lighting is obnoxious. The choreography is useless. There is not one redeeming quality to be found in this movie, not even Stallone.This movie cuts between scenes so haphazardly, it's disgusting. I swear, it's indistinguishable from a parody. You know when a movie feels like they've accidentally cut important scenes and it confuses the heck out of you? Oh yeah, that happens a lot in this crap show.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies I've ever seen
reviews.content: This is a true monstrosity. The first film was at least a little bit smart while this movie just didn't made any sense at all. The acting was terrible from every part of the cast. I especially excepted at least a little bit of an acting ability from a "veteran" actor like Stallone. The poster of the film showed only Dave Bautista and Sylvester Stallone, while both of them got very little screen time. The acting from Xiaoming Huang was so bad that I was in a state of serious cringe throughout the whole film. The plot of the film was so dumb and the screenplay was awfully written. The use of special effects was excessive and plain awful. The directing and cinematography was amateurish and showed no skill whatsoever. There is honestly nothing to like about this film. Plus there is a third installment coming out which doesn't make any sense after the enormous failure this one has been. Simply a waste of time.

reviews.review_title: Change the name from "Escape Plan" to "Dramatic Rescue Plan".
reviews.content:
Firstly, this boring sequel leads me to Escape Plan 1. Thank for that and I gave you 2 stars. The two last star is because of Stallone.
I can depict the plot and the way to escape the mega high-tech prison with 3 words: "Hack the system". Without the hacker, there is no denying that Stallone and his cellmates will never be able to get out. 
The most memorable scene: Kimbral and Shu conversation after seeing Count Zero was found. 
There are too many fighting scenes, please take a note that this is a "prison break" movie, not martial art movie. In addition, the fight which is in first 10 mins has no value.
The plot doesn't show us what the exact escape plan of the main character - Shu. The most noticeable and smart part is just after putting a mark in the wall, he knew the structure of Hades was changed randomly. Except that, Shu just self-punished.There is no link between Shu's action: Draw the structure with fairy eyes, know how the prison works but just for fun,Asking Count Zero and put him to the corporal punishment,waiting for the out side help after exhausted and then use his martial art instead of brain to get out although 2 Legions and Akala were killed.
I heard something likes "We use teamwork against technology", oh my god, change it to"we use hacker,Steven C.Miller's plot and boxing skills against technology" What is the definition of the author? Argument with brother when everything is likely over or let cellmates die for you?
Please,Escape Plan 2,you are better than this,you need to change or replace the name as "Dramatic Rescue Plan 4,5,6: Jackie Chun, Mayweather and Steve Jobs"

It's like a downward spiral all along going from bad to worse to terrible every second. It's like taking a piece from 8000 puzzle boxes and dumping them together to sell one. It's like a badly made goulash that would make Gordon Ramsey puke. It's like a freight train wreck carrying a dude missile. It's makes my favorite popcorn taste bad. It's like taking a Van Gogh painting and defacing it increasingly worse unless only final remaining missing piece is a Michael Bay touch. It's what Ramses II would do after he time traveled to medieval England and stole a bluenprint of a drawn and quartering Catherine wheel and implemented back home. It's what aliens have on a bad trip. It's like a frill-necked lizard with an ear growing out of it's body. It is so botched it actually looks like a Kirchner painting. At my death bed, I would be ruing and reminiscing that only if I had put this 90 odd minutes to doing something I love!
DO NOT WASTE TIME WATCHING THIS. B movie all the way

Once Upon a Time,
The demigods came to Pan and they yelled "Come OM! Hades is such a prick!" to which Pan replied, "Of course he's a prick! All worms wear my magic wand on their outsides!" but the demigods were very upset. So, Pan fell inside her own darkness once again to investigate what had happened when her beloved head worm Hades took over while she was away having a very long and much needed nap.

Hades told Pan her demigod kids were overreacting. He had come up with a perfect system of organization, motivation, and a great illusion called "security", which gave purpose and hope to all the children instead of letting them mindlessly churn in delusional creativity which was her destructive vice. Didn't she want her kids to be productive and happy? 

Pan agreed to monitor the children to see if what Hades said was true, and she did witness all kinds of bad childish behavior, and ultimately understood why Hades chose the punishments he did, as he even put a mirror up to Pan to show her when she too deserved such criticism. Pan agreed Hades wasn't evil, but his system of organization caused too much suffering, so she put a spell on the planet to relieve his slaves and let her nature reorganize according to more immaterial planes...like clouds. 

Of course Hades was very scared that Pan wanted to move her children into immaterial realms he couldn't control and whined "My whole Pyramid scheme will collapse!" as he had control over the rich. Pan assured him "My spell allows for a very smooth transition of power. Once everyone experiences this new way of living my beloved Hades, you will have much more time to pay attention to your pain-tings and our children will live to share their art with one another which will allow them to enjoy constant transformation."

Pan kissed Hades and left a love note for the kids "Don't be jerks, but do enjoy my dark seas. Also, Hades and I agree the Government will be sending out tax bills or withholding and won't mire you with paperwork when they don't have the staffing to handle such antiquated ways of organization. You probably think I wasn't interested in such boring affairs when crafting my future spells, but, you were never supposed to kill Time with paperwork, a huge mistake there. Lots of Love, Pan."

A low-budget straight to video sequel, Escape Plan 2: HADES is a major departure from the original.  While attending a bachelor party with his cousin, Breslin Security consultant Shu is abducted and held prisoner at a black site called HADES, and while he works to escape his team realizes what's happened and starts looking for him.  The plot doesn't make a whole lot of sense and is full of bad clichés.  Sylvester Stallone takes a backseat to Chinese marshal artist/film star Huang Xiaoming, who really doesn't have any charisma.  Also joining the cast are David Bautistia and Jaime King.  Escape Plan 2: HADES has none of the tension and suspense of the first film, and nothing fresh or exciting to offer.

This is a movie that manages to hold the audiences attention for the first five minutes of its run time and only the first five minutes of its run time.

As soon as Stallone's character - no offense to the big guy - appears on screen, this movie descends into this boring, toneless, and barely comprehensible mess that suffers from its inability to properly balance its large cast. Bautista, especially, was sidelined in such a way that his character could have easily been removed halfway through production without affecting the movie at all.

And the lack of Sylvester Stallone/Arnold Schwarzenegger interactions does not in fact cover up the fact that Escape Plan 2's basic plot is a carbon copy of its predecessor's. If anything, it only makes it more obvious.

Escape Plan 2: Hades: 3 out of 10:  Sylvester Stallone runs a firm that breaks people out of prison. After a job goes bad the team breaks up only to be brought back together when a new secret prison, the titular Hades, threatens one of their own. 

The Good: Dave Bautista is fun for the three minutes or so he is in the movie.
 
I also like the way the sets are a throwback to the Full Moon pictures of the 1980's with all the neon and bad special effects. 

The Bad: Dave Bautista is the only fun interesting character in the movie. The way he has been arguing with Disney we may see him in a lot more direct to video films like this. His loss is honestly our gain.

The movie Cube managed a much more effective future prison look on a much smaller budget twenty years ago. I found the sets and special effects hilariously bad. I am not sure the filmmakers really meant that.

The Ugly: To say this movie's plot makes no sense is an understatement. The futuristic prison contains advanced technology (healing robots, virtual reality etc) that is certainly more profitable to market to the outside world than the current kidnap people and makes them fight so they will reveal the industrial secrets business plan. It is like one of those movies where the bad guy invents a ray that can control the weather and then decided to use it to rob a bank.

In Conclusion: I have not seen the first Escape Plan but I understand it isn't that bad a movie. Why they thawed out Sylvester Stallone for this junk I have no idea. This is clearly one of those international co-productions meant for foreign audiences. This is not always a bad thing. Bloodrayne is an awful movie filled with international stars but it is also a fun movie filled with sex, violence and hammy acting. This honestly has no action, nudity or violence. Just a bunch of nobodies wandering around a set from 1980's The Apple while some American stars pop in for glorified cameos. More purgatory than Hades I am afraid.

Oh boy, the cover post with Stallone and Bautista sure fooled us! Like the first Escape Plan movie in which Arnold Schwarzenegger and Sylvester Stallone were the two main actors, Escape Plan 2 tricks you into thinking Stallone and Bautista would be the main actors. Instead you get a convoluted story in which Huang Xiaoming is the main actor playing Shu. The story, however, does pick up 2/3rds of the way through the movie when Stallone as Ray finally joins the prison to help Shu escape. 

One of the biggest differences I noticed right away between the first movie and this second one was the limited budget on explosions. They used way too much CGI, poor at that, to create fire and explosions, which really diminishes the action scenes. I miss the days when Hollywood used actual explosions and real fire (I mean, fake fire but "real") to make explosive action sequences. 

There are so many things wrong with this movie, but it's also an interesting story and if you can bypass the awkward scenes and the lack of Stallone and Bautista, it's enjoyable... but probably better to wait until it's free. After watching Escape Plan 2, to me it's no surprise this movie didn't make it to theaters and went straight to OnDemand and Redbox.

I never write reviews, but I made an account solely to write a review for this. I'm trying to think of a movie that has a more incoherent plot, but I can't. I'm trying to think of a movie that has characters that you care less about, but I can't. The deceptive poster and billing (that Sly and Bautista are stars when in fact they are hardly in it) is not even among the top 5 worst things about this movie. 1) Story is incoherent. No scene relates to the previous one or the next. I couldn't tell you what I just saw, and I was paying attention. 2) Characters are written to not care about them. 3) No clear antagonist. 4) No clear caper. 5) Characters don't behave like real people. For example, *in the middle of a car chase,* the driver calls another character to explain who he is chasing so that the viewer understands the exposition dump. I know that when I pursue someone in a high speed chase, I always ring my bud to inform him of what I'm doing for no reason at all.

I imagine Hades is a place where they force you to watch Escape Plan 2 on a loop. No Schwarzenegger and Stallone shows up just long enough to collect his paycheck. If there is anything redeeming about this VOD cash grab it is literally the last half hour when Breslin (Stallone) finally has something to do with the story. It isn't good, but almost "Stallone bad"... almost. The first Escape Plan was enjoyably lowbrow while Escape Plan 2: Hades is depressingly low budget, and hold on to your barf bags because we're facing down an Escape Plan trilogy. The third (Devil's Station) having been shot back to back with part 2... This is not a good sign. Also, Bautista is awesome and I am genuinely shocked by how much I like him as an actor, but his presence here feels nothing short of whorish.

rt_summary: Ray Breslin manages an elite team of security specialists trained in the art of breaking people out of the world's most impenetrable prisons. When his trusted operative, Shu Ren, is kidnapped and disappears inside the most elaborate prison ever built, Ray assembles an elite team to assist in the rescue.
